## NIFT Entrance Exam 2026 Admit Card Released!

The National Institute of Fashion Technology (NIFT) has released the admit card for the NIFT Entrance Exam 2026 (NIFTEE). Registered candidates can download their hall tickets from the official website.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** NIFT Entrance Exam 2026 (NIFTEE)
*   **Courses:** B.Des, B.F.Tech, M.Des, M.F.Tech, MFM
*   **Release Date:** February 4, 2026
*   **Exam Date:** February 8, 2026
*   **Download Mode:** Online

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website.
2.  Find the "NIFT Entrance Exam Admit Card 2026" link.
3.  Enter your Application Number/Registration ID, Date of Birth/Password, and Security Code.

5.  Save and print 2-3 copies.

**Important:** Download your admit card early to avoid last-minute issues.

website_content.markdown_content:
## CSIR NAL Junior Stenographer Answer Key 2026 Released!

The provisional answer key for the Junior Stenographer exam held on **08 February 2026** has been released by CSIR - National Aerospace Laboratories (CSIR NAL) on **09 February 2026**. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** CSIR - National Aerospace Laboratories (CSIR NAL)
*   **Post Name:** Junior Stenographer
*   **Exam Date:** 08 February 2026
*   **Answer Key Release Date:** 09 February 2026
*   **Last Date for Objection:** 13 February 2026 (05:00 P.M)
*   **Advertisement Number:** 03/2025

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [nal.res.in](nal.res.in).
2.  Navigate to the "Career" or "Recruitment" section.
3.  Click on the relevant notification link.
4.  Download the PDF.

**How to Raise Objections:**

*   Refer to the official notification PDF for the objection format and submission method.
*   Submit objections via email or as specified before **13 February 2026 (05:00 P.M)**.
*   Include question number, your suggested answer, and supporting documents.
*   Pay any objection fee if mentioned.

**Scoring:**

Total Score = (Correct Answers × Marks per Question) – (Wrong Answers × Negative Marking)

Refer to the official notification for the exact marking scheme.

website_content.title: JPSC Civil Services Exam 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## JPSC Civil Services Syllabus 2026

The Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC) has released the detailed syllabus for the Civil Services (Combined Competitive) Exam 2026. This guide covers the exam pattern, marking scheme, and subject-wise topics.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** JPSC Combined Civil Services Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC)
*   **Post Name:** Civil Services (Administrative, Police, etc.) & Allied Services
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (Prelims: Objective, Mains: Descriptive)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (Prelims), Descriptive (Mains)
*   **Total Questions (Prelims):** 200 (100 each paper)
*   **Total Marks (Prelims):** 400
*   **Total Marks (Mains):** 950 + Interview 100
*   **Exam Duration (Prelims):** 4 Hours (2+2)
*   **Exam Duration (Mains):** 3 Hours per paper
*   **Negative Marking:** No
*   **Selection Process:** Preliminary Exam + Main Written Exam + Interview
*   **Exam Language:** English / Hindi

**Prelims Exam Pattern:**

| Paper | Subject | Marks | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|
| Paper I | General Studies I | 200 | 2 Hours |
| Paper II | General Studies II (Jharkhand Specific + CSAT like) | 200 | 2 Hours |

**Mains Exam Pattern:**

| Paper | Subject | Marks | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|
| Paper I | General Hindi & General English (Qualifying) | 100 (50+50) | 3 Hours |
| Paper II | Language and Literature | 150 | 3 Hours |
| Paper III | Social Sciences (History & Geography) | 200 | 3 Hours |
| Paper IV | Indian Constitution & Polity, Public Administration & Good Governance | 200 | 3 Hours |
| Paper V | Indian Economy, Globalization & Sustainable Development | 200 | 3 Hours |
| Paper VI | General Sciences, Environment & Technology Development | 200 | 3 Hours |

**Key Points:**
*   Prelims is a screening test; marks are not counted in the final merit.
*   Mains total 950 marks (Paper I is qualifying).
*   Interview: 100 marks.
*   No negative marking in Prelims.

**Resources:**
*   Download the official syllabus PDF from the official website.
*   Refer to recommended books for preparation.

website_content.title: JPSC AE Syllabus 2026 Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## JPSC AE Syllabus 2026

The Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC) has released the detailed syllabus for the Assistant Engineer (AE) Exam 2026 (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical branches). Candidates can download the official syllabus PDF, exam pattern, and marking scheme.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** JPSC Assistant Engineer (AE) Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC)
*   **Post Name:** Assistant Engineer (Civil / Mechanical / Electrical)
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (CBT)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ) + Descriptive (Mains)
*   **Total Questions (Prelims):** 200
*   **Total Marks:** Prelims: 300; Mains: 1000; Interview: 200
*   **Exam Duration:** Prelims: 2 Hours each paper; Mains: 3 Hours per paper
*   **Selection Process:** Prelims + Mains + Interview/Personality Test
*   **Exam Language:** English/Hindi
*   **Official Website:** jpsc.gov.in

**Exam Pattern:**

*   **Prelims:**
    *   Paper 1: General Studies (100 Questions, 200 Marks, 2 Hours)
    *   Paper 2: Branch-specific (100 Questions, 200 Marks, 2 Hours)
*   **Mains:**
    *   Paper 1: General Hindi (100 Marks, 3 Hours)
    *   Paper 2: General English (100 Marks, 3 Hours)
    *   Paper 3: General Studies (200 Marks, 3 Hours)
    *   Paper 4: Optional Subject Paper 1 (300 Marks, 3 Hours)
    *   Paper 5: Optional Subject Paper 2 (300 Marks, 3 Hours)

**Key Points:**

*   2 marks for each correct answer in Prelims.
*   No negative marking in Mains.
*   No marks for unattempted questions in Prelims.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus and exam pattern.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Refer to standard books and NCERTs.
*   Practice previous year question papers.
*   Take regular mock tests.
*   Stay updated with current affairs.

website_content.markdown_content:
## PU MET 2025 Syllabus & Exam Details

The syllabus for the Panjab University Management Entrance Test (PU MET) 2025 is now available! This exam is for admission to MBA programs.

**Exam Date:** April 27, 2025 (Offline Mode)

**Exam Pattern:**

| Subject                          | Total Questions | Total Marks | Duration | 
|-----------------------------------|-----------------|-------------|----------|
| General Knowledge                | 200             | 200         | 2 hours  |
| Economics & Business Environment | 200             | 200         | 2 hours  |
| Data Interpretation & Problem Solving | 200             | 200         | 2 hours  |
| Numerical Ability                | 200             | 200         | 2 hours  |
| Verbal Ability / Reasoning       | 200             | 200         | 2 hours  |
| English Comprehension            | 200             | 200         | 2 hours  |

**Key Topics:**

*   **General Knowledge:** Current Affairs, Static GK, History, Geography, Science, Economy, Politics.
*   **English Language:** Grammar, Reading Comprehension, Vocabulary, Idioms & Phrases.
*   **Logical Reasoning:** Blood Relations, Puzzles, Coding-Decoding, Direction Sense.
*   **Quantitative Ability:** Percentages, Numbers, Geometry, Ratio, Time-Speed-Distance, Algebra.
*   **Data Interpretation:** Bar Graphs, Line Graphs, Pie Charts, Data Sufficiency.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the exam pattern.
*   Break down the syllabus.
*   Create a study schedule.
*   Use quality study material.
*   Practice mock tests.
*   Focus on weak areas.
*   Stay updated with current affairs.

website_content.title: HSSC Forest Guard Syllabus 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## HSSC Forest Guard Syllabus 2026

The Haryana Staff Selection Commission (HSSC) has released the detailed syllabus and exam pattern for the Forest Guard Exam 2026. This guide covers subject-wise topics, preparation strategy, and important information.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** HSSC Forest Guard Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Haryana Staff Selection Commission (HSSC)
*   **Post Name:** Forest Guard / Forester
*   **Vacancies:** 779
*   **Advt. No.:** 04/2026
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (OMR-based)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 100
*   **Total Marks:** 100
*   **Exam Duration:** 1 Hour 45 Minutes
*   **Negative Marking:** No
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam + PST/PET + Document Verification

**Exam Pattern:**

| Subjects / Sections | Weightage | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| General Awareness, Reasoning, Mathematics, Science, History (Related to Haryana), Current Affairs, Geography, Civics, Environment, Culture, Literature | 20% | 20 | 20 | 1 Hour 45 Minutes |
| Computer terminologies, Computer abbreviations, Hardware and Software, Keyboard shortcuts, Networking, Operating System, Internet, MS Office | 10% | 10 | 10 | |
| Subject Related Topic | 70% | 70 | 70 | |
| **Total** | **100%** | **100** | **100** | |

**Key Highlights:**

*   Each question carries 1 mark.
*   No negative marking.
*   Question paper will be bilingual (English & Hindi).
*   Questions are generally of 10th standard level.

**Subject-Wise Topics:**

*   **General Awareness:** India & neighboring countries, History, Culture, Geography, Economics, General Policies, Scientific Research.
*   **General Intelligence / Reasoning:** Semantic Analogy, Symbolic Operations, Number Series, etc.
*   **English Language:** Spot an error, Synonyms/Antonyms, Idioms and phrases, etc.
*   **Quantitative Aptitude / Mathematics:** Number System, Mensuration, Algebra, etc.
*   **Computer Knowledge:** Computer terminologies, Hardware & Software, Networking, MS Office.
*   **Haryana Economy:** Agriculture, income, population, health, MSMEs, SEZs.
*   **Environmental Studies and Disaster Management:** Natural resources, Ecosystem, Pollution control, Disaster Management.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus.
*   Create a realistic study timetable.
*   Practice previous year papers and mock tests.
*   Focus on Haryana GK and Environment.
*   Improve speed and accuracy.
*   Stay updated with current affairs.
*   Maintain physical fitness.

website_content.markdown_content:
## MP SET Admit Card 2026 – Download Now!

The Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC) has released the admit card for the State Eligibility Test (SET) 2026.

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** 20 February 2026
*   **Exam Date:** 1 March 2026
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (Pen & Paper Based)
*   **Purpose:** Eligibility for Assistant Professor Posts

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official MPPSC website: mppsc.mp.gov.in
2.  Navigate to the "Admit Card" or "Latest Announcements" section.
3.  Click on "MP SET Admit Card 2026".
4.  Enter your Application/Registration Number, Date of Birth, and Captcha Code.
5.  Download and print the admit card (2-3 copies recommended).

**Important Documents to Carry:**

*   MP SET Admit Card 2026 (printed copy)
*   Valid Photo ID Proof (Aadhaar, Voter ID, Driving License, PAN Card, Passport)
*   Recent passport-size photographs (2 copies)
*   Blue/Black ballpoint pen

**Pro Tip:** Check all details on your admit card immediately after download and report any discrepancies to MPPSC within 24 hours.

**Important Dates:**

*   Application Start Date: 25 October 2025 (Completed)
*   Application Last Date: 27 November 2025 (Completed)
*   Admit Card Release Date: 20 February 2026 (Live Now)
*   Exam Date: 1 March 2026 (Upcoming)

website_content.markdown_content:
## AIIMS BSc Nursing Syllabus 2025 Released!

The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has released the updated syllabus for the AIIMS BSc Nursing Entrance Exam 2025. This syllabus is essential for candidates preparing for BSc (H) Nursing, BSc Nursing (Post-Basic), and BSc Paramedical courses.

**Key Details:**

*   **Subjects Covered:** Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and General Knowledge.
*   **Exam Pattern:**
    *   Physics: 30 Questions
    *   Chemistry: 30 Questions
    *   Biology: 30 Questions
    *   General Knowledge: 10 Questions
    *   Total: 100 Questions
    *   Duration: 2 hours (120 minutes)
*   **Key Topics:**
    *   **Physics:** Current Electricity, Electromagnetic Induction, Electronic Devices, and more.
    *   **Chemistry:** Solid State, Biomolecules, Polymers, and more.
    *   **Biology:** Cell Theory, Mendel’s Laws of Inheritance, Classification, and more.
    *   **General Knowledge:** Current Affairs, History, Geography, Culture.

Download the syllabus PDF and start your preparation today!

website_content.title: RRB Group D Syllabus 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## RRB Group D Syllabus 2026

The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) has released the detailed syllabus and exam pattern for Group D (Level-1) Exam 2026. This guide covers subject-wise topics, preparation strategy, and important books.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** RRB Group D (Level-1) Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Railway Recruitment Board (RRB)
*   **Post Name:** Group D
*   **Total Vacancies:** 22195
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (CBT)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 100
*   **Total Marks:** 100
*   **Exam Duration:** 90 Minutes (120 for PwBD)
*   **Negative Marking:** 1/3 mark deducted per wrong answer
*   **Selection Process:** CBT + PET + Document Verification + Medical Examination
*   **Exam Language:** English, Hindi, and 13 Regional Languages

**Exam Pattern (CBT Stage):**

| Subject / Section             | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration | 
| ----------------------------- | ---------------- | ----- | -------- | 
| Mathematics                   | 25               | 25    | 90 Minutes | 
| General Intelligence & Reasoning | 30               | 30    |          | 
| General Science               | 25               | 25    |          | 
| General Awareness & Current Affairs | 20               | 20    |          | 
| **Total**                     | **100**          | **100** |          | 

**Subject-Wise Topics:**

1.  **Mathematics:** Number System, Decimals & Fractions, LCM & HCF, Ratio & Proportion, Percentage, Mensuration, Time & Work, Time & Distance, Simple & Compound Interest, Profit & Loss, Algebra, Geometry & Trigonometry, Elementary Statistics, Square Root, Age Calculations, Calendar & Clock, Pipes & Cistern.
2.  **General Intelligence & Reasoning:** Analogies, Alphabetical & Number Series, Coding-Decoding, Mathematical Operations, Relationships, Syllogism, Jumbling, Venn Diagram, Data Interpretation, Conclusions & Decision Making, Similarities & Differences, Analytical Reasoning, Classification, Directions, Statement – Arguments & Assumptions, Puzzles.
3.  **General Science:** Physics, Chemistry, Biology (up to 10th CBSE/NCERT level).
4.  **General Awareness & Current Affairs:** Current Affairs (National & International - Last 6-12 months), Indian History, Geography, Polity & Constitution, Indian Economy & Budget, Static GK, Indian Railways & Railway Budget, Science & Technology, Art & Culture, Government Schemes, Environmental Issues.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Use NCERT basics for Science.
*   Practice previous year papers & mock tests.
*   Focus on current affairs.
*   Master time management.
*   Prepare for PET.

**Recommended Books:**

*   Mathematics: Quantitative Aptitude for Competitive Examinations - R.S. Aggarwal
*   Reasoning: A Modern Approach to Verbal & Non-Verbal Reasoning - R.S. Aggarwal
*   General Science: Lucent's General Science - Lucent Publications
*   General Awareness: Lucent's General Knowledge + Current Affairs Magazine - Lucent / Pratiyogita Darpan

website_content.title: RBI Assistant Recruitment 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## RBI Assistant Recruitment 2026

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has announced a recruitment drive for 650 Assistant positions across various offices in India.

**Important Dates:**
*   Application Start Date: February 16, 2026
*   Application End Date: March 08, 2026
*   Preliminary Examination: April 11, 2026 (Tentative)
*   Main Examination: June 07, 2026 (Tentative)

**Exam Pattern:**

*   **Prelims:** 100 marks, 60 minutes (sectional timing)
    *   English Language (30 questions, 30 marks, 20 mins)
    *   Numerical Ability (35 questions, 35 marks, 20 mins)
    *   Reasoning Ability (35 questions, 35 marks, 20 mins)
*   **Mains:** 200 marks, 135 minutes (sectional timing)
    *   Test of Reasoning (40 questions, 40 marks, 30 mins)
    *   Test of English Language (40 questions, 40 marks, 30 mins)
    *   Test of Numerical Ability (40 questions, 40 marks, 30 mins)
    *   Test of General Awareness (40 questions, 40 marks, 25 mins)
    *   Test of Computer Knowledge (40 questions, 40 marks, 20 mins)

**Syllabus:**

*   **Prelims:** English, Numerical Ability, Reasoning, General Awareness, Computer Knowledge.
*   **Mains:** Detailed syllabus for each test is available in the official notification.

**Language Proficiency Test (LPT):** Mandatory and qualifying for shortlisted candidates.

**Negative Marking:** ¼ (0.25) for each wrong answer in both Prelims and Mains.

Download the detailed syllabus and exam details [here](Click Here).

website_content.title: Rajasthan Police SI Recruitment 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## Rajasthan Police SI Syllabus 2026

The Rajasthan Police SI Syllabus 2026 is a key resource for candidates preparing for the Sub-Inspector recruitment through the Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC). The latest details align with the Sub Inspector/Platoon Commander Competitive Examination pattern. The process includes a written exam, physical tests, and more.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** Rajasthan Police Sub-Inspector (SI) Recruitment 2026
*   **Conducting Authority:** Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC)
*   **Exam Level:** State-level competitive examination
*   **Mode of Exam:** Offline/OMR-based Written Exam (Objective type)
*   **Selection Stages:** Written Exam, Physical Measurement Test (PMT), Physical Efficiency Test (PET), Interview, Document Verification, Medical Examination
*   **Total Written Marks:** 400 marks (200 + 200)

**Exam Pattern:**

| Paper | Subject                      | Questions | Marks | Duration | Type        |
|-------|------------------------------|-----------|-------|----------|-------------|
| I     | General Hindi                | 100       | 200   | 2 hours  | Objective (MCQ) |
| II    | General Knowledge & Science | 100       | 200   | 2 hours  | Objective (MCQ) |

**Marking Scheme:**

*   +2 marks for each correct answer
*   -1/3 marks for each wrong answer

**Physical Standards:**

*   **Male:** Height: 168 cm, Chest: 81 cm (unexpanded) to 86 cm (expanded)
*   **Female:** Height: 152 cm

**Resources:**

*   Standard Hindi grammar books
*   Rajasthan GK books
*   NCERT textbooks (Class 6–10) for science and social science
*   Previous year papers

website_content.title: AP Inter Hall Ticket 2026 Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## AP Inter Hall Ticket 2026 Released!

The Board of Intermediate Education, Andhra Pradesh (BIEAP) has released the hall tickets for 1st and 2nd Year Intermediate Public Examinations scheduled from February–March 2026.

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** February 13, 2026
*   **Exam Dates:**
    *   1st Year: February 23, 2026 – March 24, 2026 (Some dates revised)
    *   2nd Year: February 24, 2026 – March 23, 2026 (Maths & Civics shifted to March 4)
*   **Exam Time:** 9:00 AM to 12:00 Noon

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [bie.ap.gov.in](bie.ap.gov.in).
2.  Click on "Theory Hall Tickets (First & Second Year) IPE February/March 2026".
3.  Select your year (1st or 2nd).
4.  Enter your credentials (10th hall ticket/Aadhaar for 1st year, 1st year hall ticket/Aadhaar for 2nd year) and Date of Birth (DD-MM-YYYY).
5.  Download and print the hall ticket (at least two copies).

**Important:** Verify all details on your hall ticket (name, photo, exam center, subjects). Contact your college principal for any corrections.

The Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC) has released the detailed syllabus for the Assistant Director, Farmers Welfare & Agricultural Development (Field Extension) and State Forest Service Mains Examination 2026.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** MPPSC Assistant Director / State Forest Service Mains Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC)
*   **Post Name:** Assistant Director, Farmers Welfare & Agricultural Development (Field Extension) & State Forest Service (Mains)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (Mains)
*   **Total Marks:** 450 Marks
*   **Exam Duration:** 3 Hours
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes - 1 Mark
*   **Selection Process:** Prelims (if applicable) + Mains Written Exam + Interview
*   **Exam Language:** English / Hindi

**Exam Pattern (Overview):**

**Assistant Director:**
*   Paper I: General Studies & MP GK - 150 Marks (3 Hours)
*   Paper II: Agriculture/Extension - 300 Marks
*   Interview: 50 Marks

**State Forest Service:**
*   Paper I: General Studies & MP GK, National Parks & Wildlife - 150 Marks (3 Hours)
*   Paper II: Forestry - 300 Marks
*   Interview: 50 Marks

**Download Syllabus PDFs:**

*   [Assistant Director Syllabus](Click Here to Download)

## UPSC Assistant Commandants (Group A) Recruitment 2026

**Notification Released:** 20th February 2026

website_content.title: CTET 2026 Answer Key
website_content.markdown_content:
## CTET Answer Key 2026 – Download PDF, Response Sheet & Objection Link

The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) is expected to release the CTET Answer Key 2026 soon. Candidates who appeared for the CTET examination held on February 7 & 8, 2026, can download the provisional answer key from the official website.

This is the 21st edition of CTET for Paper 1 (Classes I-V) and Paper 2 (Classes VI-VIII).  You can raise objections if you find any discrepancies.

**Quick Overview:**

*   **Organization:** Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE)
*   **Post Name:** Central Teacher Eligibility Test (CTET)
*   **Exam Date:** February 7 & 8, 2026
*   **Answer Key Status:** Expected Soon
*   **Release Date:** February 2026 (Expected)
*   **Last Date for Objection:** To be announced (2-3 days after release)
*   **Official Website:** [ctet.nic.in](ctet.nic.in)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [ctet.nic.in](ctet.nic.in)
2.  Navigate to the "Candidate Activity" or "Answer Key" section.
3.  Click on "View/Challenge Answer Key – CTET Feb 2026".
4.  Log in using your Roll Number and Date of Birth.
5.  Download the PDF.

**How to Raise Objection:**

1.  Log in to your candidate portal on [ctet.nic.in](ctet.nic.in).
2.  Go to the "Challenge/Objection" section.
3.  Select the question(s) to challenge.
4.  Upload supporting documents (if required).
5.  Pay the objection fee (₹1000 per question, refundable if accepted).
6.  Submit before the deadline.

**Important Dates:**

*   Exam Conducted: February 7 & 8, 2026
*   Provisional Answer Key Released: February 2026 (Expected)
*   Last Date to Raise Objection: To be announced

**Marking Scheme:**

*   Correct Answer: +1 mark
*   Wrong Answer: No negative marking
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

website_content.title: NMMS Result 2026 Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## NMMS Result 2026 - State-Wise Release

The National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship (NMMS) result for the 2025-26 academic session (commonly searched as NMMS Result 2026) is being released state-wise by the State Councils of Educational Research and Training (SCERTs) and education departments.

**As of February 19, 2026, results have been declared in:** Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Uttarakhand, Nagaland, Mizoram, Meghalaya, and Bihar. Other states are expected to release results in the coming weeks/months.

**What is NMMS?**

NMMS is a centrally sponsored scheme providing financial support to meritorious Class 8 students from economically weaker sections to reduce dropouts and encourage education up to Class 12.

**Who should check?**

*   Class 8 students who appeared for the NMMS exam
*   Parents
*   Schools

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship (NMMS) for Class 8
*   **Conducted By:** State Education Departments / SCERTs
*   **Academic Session:** 2025-26
*   **Result Mode:** Online (PDF/Login-based)
*   **Details on Result:** Student name, Roll/application number, Parent's name, School details, Category, MAT/SAT marks, Total marks, Qualifying status.

**Cut-Off (Approximate):**

*   General/OBC: ~40% in each paper
*   SC/ST/PwD: ~32% in each

**Next Steps:** Document verification, PFMS/DBT registration, and scholarship disbursement.

**Important Note:** Qualifying criteria vary by state. Refer to your state's official notification for exact rules.

The Shri Ram College of Commerce (SRCC) has released the admit card for the Post Graduate Diploma in Global Business Operations (PGDGBO) entrance exam.

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** 20 February 2026
*   **Exam Date:** 28 February 2026
*   **Download Status:** Active Now
*   **Exam Mode:** Computer Based Test (CBT)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official SRCC website: srcc.edu or srccgbo.edu.in
2.  Find the "PGDBO Admit Card 2026" or "Hall Ticket" link.
3.  Login with your User ID and Password.
4.  Download and save the PDF.
5.  Print 2-3 copies for exam day.

**Important Documents to Carry:**

*   Printed Admit Card
*   Valid Photo ID (Aadhaar, Passport, Driving License, Voter ID)
*   Passport-size photographs (if specified)
*   Black/Blue ballpoint pen (if required)

**What to Avoid:**

*   Mobile phones and electronic devices
*   Study materials
*   Calculator (unless permitted)
*   Bags or prohibited items

**Important Dates:**

*   Registration Start Date: 15 December 2025
*   Registration Last Date: 31 January 2026
*   Admit Card Release Date: 20 February 2026
*   Exam Date: 28 February 2026

If you face any issues downloading your admit card, clear your browser cache, try a different browser, verify your registration, or contact the SRCC helpdesk.

website_content.title: NTA NIFTEE 2026 Answer Key Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## NTA NIFTEE 2026 Provisional Answer Key – Important Details

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the Provisional Answer Key for the NIFT Entrance Examination (NIFTEE) 2026 – General Ability Test (GAT) paper on **February 17, 2026**. Candidates can access their response sheets and the answer key on the official portal.

**Key Dates:**

*   **Exam Date:** February 8, 2026
*   **Answer Key & Response Sheet Release:** February 17, 2026
*   **Objection Window:** February 17 – February 19, 2026 (11:50 PM)
*   **Final Answer Key Release:** Expected March – April 2026

**How to Raise Objections:**

*   Log in to the NTA NIFT portal.
*   Navigate to the “Challenge Provisional Answer Key” section.
*   Select the question(s) and provide justification.
*   Upload supporting proof (if required).
*   Pay a non-refundable fee of ₹200 per question.

**Programmes:** B.Des, B.F.Tech, M.Des, M.F.Tech, and MFM.

**Note:** No answer key is released for the CAT (Creative Ability Test).

website_content.title: Indian Army NCC Special Entry
website_content.markdown_content:
## Indian Army NCC Special Entry Recruitment 2026

The Indian Army is recruiting 70 candidates for NCC Special Entry Posts. Interested and eligible candidates can apply online.

**Key Details:**

*   **Total Vacancies:** 70
*   **Course:** 124th Course (October 2026)
*   **Salary:** Rs. 56,100 – Rs. 2,18,200/- Per Month (CTC approx 17-18 Lakh per annum)
*   **Eligibility:** Graduation Degree with NCC 'C' Certificate (Minimum 'B' Grade)
*   **Age Limit:** 19 to 25 years as of 01 July 2026 (Born between 02 July 2001 and 01 July 2007)
*   **Application Start Date:** 12 February 2026 (1500 Hours)
*   **Application Last Date:** 16 March 2026 (1500 Hours)
*   **Apply Mode:** Online

**Vacancy Breakdown:**

*   NCC Men (General Category): 63
*   Wards of Battle Casualties: 07

**Important Dates:**

*   Shortlisting for SSB: Tentatively First week of May 2026
*   SSB Interview: May/June 2026
*   Training Commencement: October 2026

**Selection Process:** Application Submission -> Shortlisting -> SSB Interview -> Medical Examination -> Merit List Preparation -> Joining Letter

**Note:** Candidates must submit only one application. The date of birth must match the Matriculation Certificate.

website_content.markdown_content:
## APSC Grade 4 Result 2026 - Phase-I Screening Test

The Assam Public Service Commission (APSC) has released the result for the Phase-I Screening Test (OMR Based) for Grade-IV posts on February 20, 2026.

**Key Details:**

*   **Recruiting Body:** Assam Public Service Commission (APSC)
*   **Post Name:** Grade-IV
*   **Result Type:** Phase-I: Screening Test (OMR Based) Result
*   **Result Declaration Date:** February 20, 2026
*   **Exam Conducted On:** January 4, 2026
*   **Selection Stages:** Screening Test → Interview/Document Verification → Final Merit
*   **Official Website:** [apsc.nic.in](https://apsc.nic.in)

**How to Check Result:**

1.  Visit the official APSC website: [apsc.nic.in](https://apsc.nic.in).
2.  Navigate to the “Results” or “Notifications” section.
3.  Find the link: “Result of the Phase-I: Screening Test (OMR Based), Grade-IV, Assam Public Service Commission [Advt. No. 30/2025]” dated February 20, 2026.
4.  Download the merit list PDF.
5.  Search for your Roll Number/Application ID using Ctrl+F.

**Merit List Contains:**

*   Roll Number/Application ID
*   Candidate Name (in some cases)
*   Category (if applicable)
*   Qualifying Status

**Next Steps:** Qualified candidates will be called for Interview/Document Verification. Keep checking the official website for updates.

2.  Navigate to the "What's New" or "Candidate's Corner" section.

4.  Enter your Application Number/Registration Number and Date of Birth.

**Important Documents to Carry:**

*   Admit Card (printed copy)
*   Valid Photo ID Proof (Aadhaar, Voter ID, Driving License, PAN Card, Passport)
*   Passport-size photographs (2 copies)
*   Blue/Black ballpoint pen

**Important Instructions:**

*   Check all details on the admit card immediately after download.
*   Report any discrepancies to the OPSC helpdesk within 24 hours.
*   Reach the exam center 45-60 minutes before reporting time.
*   Entry closes 30 minutes before the exam starts.

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the Provisional Answer Key for the All India Sainik Schools Entrance Examination (AISSEE) 2026 on February 11, 2026.

**Key Dates:**
*   **Exam Date:** January 18, 2026
*   **Answer Key Release:** February 11, 2026
*   **Last Date to Raise Objections:** February 14, 2026 (up to 11:50 PM)
*   **Final Answer Key & Result:** Expected in March 2026

**How to Download:**
1.  Visit the NTA portal: exams.nta.nic.in/sainik-school-society
2.  Click on the "AISSEE 2026 Provisional Answer Key" link.
3.  Log in with your Application Number and Password.
4.  View/Download the Answer Key, OMR Sheet, and Recorded Responses.

**Challenging the Answer Key:**
*   Fee: ₹200 per question for answer key challenges, ₹100 per recorded response for OMR disputes.
*   Deadline: February 14, 2026

**Exam Pattern:**
*   **Class 6:** Total 300 Marks (Maths: 150, GK: 50, Language: 50, Intelligence: 50)
*   **Class 9:** Total 400 Marks (Maths: 200, English: 100, Science: 100, Social Studies: 100)

**Next Steps:**
*   Final Answer Key & Result in March 2026.
*   Scorecard download using Application Number + DOB/Password.
*   Merit List released school-wise and category-wise.
*   Counselling through AISSAC portal: pesa.ncog.gov.in

website_content.title: WBSSC Group D Syllabus 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## WBSSC Group D Syllabus 2026

The West Bengal Central School Service Commission (WBSSC) has released the detailed syllabus for the Group D Exam 2026. This guide covers the exam pattern, marking scheme, and subject-wise topics.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** WBSSC Group D Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** West Bengal Central School Service Commission (WBSSC)
*   **Post Name:** Group D
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (OMR-based)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 45
*   **Total Marks:** 45
*   **Exam Duration:** 1 Hour
*   **Negative Marking:** No
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam + Interview
*   **Exam Language:** English/Bengali

**Exam Pattern:**

| Subject/Section | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration |
|---|---|---|---|
| General Knowledge | 15 | 15 | 1 Hour |
| Current Affairs | 15 | 15 | |
| Arithmetic | 15 | 15 | |
| **Total** | **45** | **45** | |

**Syllabus Breakdown:**

1.  **General Knowledge:** Environment and society.
2.  **Current Affairs:** Recent events, West Bengal & Indian states (sports, history, culture, geography).
3.  **Arithmetic:** Number systems, simplification, decimals, fractions, LCM, HCF, averages, ratio and proportion, percentage, profit and loss, discount, simple interest, time and work, time and distance (Class 8 level).

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus and exam pattern.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Use standard reference books.
*   Practice previous year papers.
*   Take mock tests.
*   Stay updated on current affairs.
*   Master time management.

**Recommended Books:**

*   **General Knowledge:** Lucent's General Knowledge / West Bengal GK
*   **Current Affairs:** Pratiyogita Darpan / Monthly Magazines
*   **Arithmetic:** Quantitative Aptitude for Competitive Examinations (Basic Level) - R.S. Aggarwal

website_content.title: AISSEE 2026 Answer Key
website_content.markdown_content:
## AISSEE 2026 Answer Key - Expected Soon!

The National Testing Agency (NTA) will soon release the provisional answer key for the All India Sainik Schools Entrance Exam (AISSEE) 2026 for Class 6 & 9.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Date:** January 18, 2026
*   **Release Date:** Late January / Early February 2026 (Expected)
*   **Admission For:** Class 6 and Class 9
*   **Download Mode:** Online
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (OMR-based)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website.
2.  Find the "AISSEE 2026 Provisional Answer Key" link.
3.  Enter your Application Number/Roll Number, Date of Birth/Password, and Security Code.
4.  Download and verify your responses.
5.  Save and print for raising objections.

**Objection Process:**

*   Objection Fee: ₹200 per question (usually)
*   Submit valid proof with your objection.
*   Objections without fee or proof may be rejected.
*   Final answer key will be released after reviewing valid objections.

website_content.markdown_content:
## RBI Office Attendant Recruitment 2026

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has announced a recruitment drive for 572 Office Attendant positions. Here are the key details:

**Important Dates:**

*   **Notification Release:** 15 January 2026 (Completed)
*   **Application Start:** 15 January 2026 (Completed)
*   **Application Last Date:** 4 February 2026 (Completed)
*   **Admit Card Release Date:** 21 February 2026 (Expected)
*   **Exam Date:** 28 February & 1 March 2026
*   **Result Declaration:** To be announced

**Key Details:**

*   **Total Vacancies:** 572
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (Computer Based Test)
*   **Exam Duration:** 90 minutes for 120 questions

**Admit Card Information:**

*   Admit cards will be available for download from rbi.org.in or opportunities.rbi.org.in.
*   Candidates must carry a printed copy of the admit card along with a valid photo ID (Aadhaar Card, Voter ID, Driving License, PAN Card, or Passport) and recent passport-size photographs.
*   Prohibited items include mobile phones, smartwatches, calculators, books, and bags.

**Documents Required:**

*   Admit Card
*   Valid Photo ID
*   Passport-size photographs

**What to do if you can't download your admit card:**

*   Clear browser cache and cookies.
*   Try a different browser.
*   Check your application status.
*   Contact the RBI helpdesk.

website_content.title: UPSC Civil Services Examination 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) 2026

The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has announced the Civil Services Examination 2026 for recruitment to Group A & Group B services like IAS, IPS, and IFS.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Union Public Service Commission (UPSC)
*   **Exam Name:** Civil Services Examination (CSE) 2026
*   **Total Vacancies:** Approximately 933
*   **Eligibility:** Graduate Degree (Any Discipline)
*   **Age Limit:** 21–32 Years (as on 01-08-2026)
*   **Exam Stages:** Preliminary, Main, Interview
*   **Online Application Start Date:** 04/02/2026
*   **Online Application Last Date:** 24/02/2026 (6:00 PM)
*   **Application Mode:** Online

**Exam Pattern:**

*   **Preliminary Exam:**
    *   Paper I (GS): 200 Marks, 2 Hours (Objective)
    *   Paper II (CSAT): 200 Marks, 2 Hours (Objective, Qualifying - 33% minimum)
*   **Main Exam:** 9 Papers (7 Merit-based, 2 Qualifying - Indian Language & English). Total Marks: 1750
*   **Interview:** 275 Marks

**Application Fee:**

*   General / OBC / EWS: Rs. 100/- 
*   SC / ST / PwBD / Women: Nil

**Important Dates:**

*   Notification Release Date: 04 February 2026
*   Apply Online Last Date: 24 February 2026 (6:00 PM)
*   Preliminary Exam Date: 24 May 2026

website_content.markdown_content:
## UPSC Indian Economic Service/Indian Statistical Service Recruitment 2026

The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has announced a recruitment drive for 44 positions in the Indian Economic Service (IES) and Indian Statistical Service (ISS).

**Key Details:**

*   **Total Vacancies:** 44 (IES: 16, ISS: 28)
*   **Eligibility:**
    *   **IES:** Post-Graduate Degree in Economics/Applied Economics/Business Economics/Econometrics
    *   **ISS:** Bachelor's/Master's Degree in Statistics (various specializations)
*   **Age Limit:** 21-30 years (as of 1st August 2026). Relaxations apply for SC/ST (5 years), OBC (3 years), Ex-servicemen (5 years), and PwBD (10 years).
*   **Application Fee:** Rs. 200 for General/OBC, Nil for Female/SC/ST/PwBD
*   **Important Dates:**
    *   **Notification Date:** 11 February 2026
    *   **Application Start:** 11 February 2026
    *   **Application Last Date:** 03 March 2026
    *   **Examination Start Date:** 19 June 2026
*   **Selection Process:** Written Examination (1000 marks) & Viva Voce/Personality Test (200 marks)
*   **Apply Mode:** Online

Candidates are advised to download and carefully read the official notification for detailed information.

website_content.title: GSEB SSC Admit Card 2026 Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## GSEB SSC Admit Card 2026 - Important Information

The Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSEB) has released the admit cards for the SSC (Class 10) exams scheduled from **February 26th to March 18th, 2026**. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Board:** Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSEB)
*   **Exam Name:** GSEB Secondary School Certificate (SSC) / Class 10 Board Exam 2026
*   **Admit Card Status:** Released (available for school download)
*   **Exam Dates:** February 26, 2026 - March 18, 2026
*   **Download Mode:** Online (school login only - gseb.org)
*   **Distribution:** Students will receive their admit cards from their respective schools.

**Important Instructions:**

*   Students *cannot* download admit cards individually.
*   Schools must print, sign, and stamp the admit cards before distributing them.
*   Verify all details on the admit card upon receipt.
*   Carry the admit card and a valid school ID to the exam center.
*   Prohibited items include mobile phones, smartwatches, and unfair means materials.

**Error Correction:** Any discrepancies should be reported to the school immediately for correction through official channels.

**Links:**

*   [Official Website](https://gseb.org)

website_content.title: AAI Senior Assistant 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## AAI Senior Assistant Syllabus 2026 Released!

The Airports Authority of India (AAI) has released the syllabus for Senior Assistant posts, including the Computer Literacy Test component (released on **06-02-2026** for Senior Assistant (Accounts) and related disciplines).

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** AAI Senior Assistant Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Airports Authority of India (AAI)
*   **Post Name:** Senior Assistant (Accounts, Electronics, Official Language, etc.)
*   **Syllabus Release Date (Computer Literacy):** 06 February 2026
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (CBT)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Exam Duration:** 2 Hours
*   **Negative Marking:** Usually No (Confirm in official notification)
*   **Selection Process:** CBT + Computer Literacy/Skill Test + Document Verification
*   **Exam Language:** English / Hindi

**Computer Literacy Test Focus (Accounts):**

*   MS-Word: Document creation, formatting, tables, mail merge.
*   MS-Excel: Formulas (SUM, AVERAGE, VLOOKUP), charts, pivot tables.
*   MS-PowerPoint: Slide creation, animations.
*   General Computer Knowledge: Fundamentals, OS, internet, file management.

**Other Sections:**

*   General Knowledge
*   Reasoning
*   English Language
*   Subject-Specific Knowledge

Download the official syllabus PDF and prepare thoroughly!  Stay updated with the AAI website for the full notification and exam dates.

website_content.markdown_content:
## REET Mains Answer Key 2026 – Download PDF, Response Sheet & Objection Link

The Rajasthan Staff Selection Board (RSSB) is expected to release the REET Mains Answer Key 2026 soon.

**Exam Details:**
*   **Exam Name:** REET Mains
*   **Exam Date:** 17th to 20th January 2026
*   **Release Date:** 3rd or 4th Week of February 2026
*   **Objection Deadline:** Within a specified period after release
*   **Objection Fee:** ₹100 per question (refundable if accepted)

**How to Download:**
1.  Visit [rssb.rajasthan.gov.in](rssb.rajasthan.gov.in).
2.  Navigate to the "Answer Key" or "Recruitment" section.
3.  Click on the "REET Mains Answer Key 2026" link.
4.  Log in (if required) or download the set-wise PDFs.

**How to Raise an Objection:**
1.  Log in to the candidate portal on [rssb.rajasthan.gov.in](rssb.rajasthan.gov.in).
2.  Go to the "Challenge/Objection" section.
3.  Select the question(s) to challenge.
4.  Upload supporting documents (if required).
5.  Pay the objection fee.
6.  Submit before the deadline.

**Marking Scheme:**
*   Correct Answer: +2 marks
*   Wrong Answer: -1/3 mark
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

website_content.title: RPF SI Exam 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## RPF SI Syllabus 2026

The Railway Protection Force (RPF) has released the detailed syllabus and exam pattern for the Sub-Inspector (SI) Exam 2026. Candidates preparing for the RPF SI recruitment can download the official syllabus details, exam pattern, and marking scheme.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** RPF Sub-Inspector (SI) Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) / Railway Protection Force (RPF)
*   **Post Name:** Sub-Inspector
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (Computer-Based Test - CBT)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 120
*   **Total Marks:** 120
*   **Exam Duration:** 90 Minutes
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes - 1/3 mark deducted for each wrong answer
*   **Selection Process:** CBT + Physical Efficiency Test (PET) / Physical Measurement Test (PMT) + Document Verification + Medical Examination
*   **Exam Language:** English, Hindi, and 13 Regional Languages

**Exam Pattern (CBT Stage):**

| Subject / Section | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration |
|---|---|---|---| 
| General Awareness | 50 | 50 | 90 Minutes |
| Arithmetic | 35 | 35 | |
| General Intelligence & Reasoning | 35 | 35 | |
| **Total** | **120** | **120** | |

**Syllabus Breakdown:**

*   **General Awareness:** Indian History, Art & Culture, Indian Geography & Polity, Indian Economy & Current Affairs, General Science, Static GK, Indian Railways, Government Schemes, Environmental Issues, Indian Constitution, Current Events related to Railways & Security.
*   **Arithmetic:** Number System, Decimals & Fractions, LCM & HCF, Ratio & Proportion, Percentage, Mensuration, Time & Work, Time & Distance, Simple & Compound Interest, Profit & Loss, Algebra, Geometry, Statistics.
*   **General Intelligence & Reasoning:** Analogies, Series, Coding-Decoding, Mathematical Operations, Blood Relations, Syllogism, Venn Diagram, Data Interpretation, Conclusions, Similarities & Differences, Analytical Reasoning, Classification, Directions & Ranking, Puzzles.

**Important Points:**

*   Minimum qualifying marks: UR/EWS - 35%, OBC/SC/ST - 30% (may vary).
*   PET/PMT: Running (1600m for males), Long Jump, High Jump.

**Recommended Books:**

*   Arithmetic: Quantitative Aptitude by R.S. Aggarwal
*   Reasoning: A Modern Approach to Verbal & Non-Verbal Reasoning by R.S. Aggarwal
*   General Awareness: Lucent's General Knowledge
*   General Science: Lucent's General Science

website_content.markdown_content:
## Kerala PSC Women Civil Excise Officer Syllabus 2026

The Kerala Public Service Commission (Kerala PSC) has released the syllabus for the Women Civil Excise Officer (Trainee) Exam 2026 (Category No. 502/2023).

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** Kerala PSC Women Civil Excise Officer (Trainee) Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Kerala Public Service Commission (Kerala PSC)
*   **Post Name:** Women Civil Excise Officer (Trainee)
*   **Exam Mode:** Online/OMR
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 100
*   **Total Marks:** 100
*   **Exam Duration:** 1 Hour 30 Minutes
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes (0.33 marks deducted for each wrong answer)
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam + Physical Efficiency Test / Endurance Test
*   **Exam Language:** English & Malayalam

**Exam Pattern:**

| Part | Subject/Section | Marks | Duration |
|---|---|---|---| 
| I | General Knowledge | 40 | 1 Hour 30 Minutes |
| II | Current Affairs | 10 | |
| III | Arithmetic, Mental Ability, Observation | 10 | |
| IV | General English | 10 | |
| V | Regional Language | 10 | |
| VI | Excise & Prohibition Laws | 20 | |

**Key Topics:**

*   **General Knowledge:** History, Geography, Economics, Indian Constitution, Kerala Administration, Biology, Physics, Chemistry, Arts & Culture.
*   **Current Affairs:** National & International Events (last 6-12 months), Kerala developments.
*   **Arithmetic & Mental Ability:** Numbers, Percentage, Profit & Loss, Series, Analogies.
*   **English:** Grammar, Vocabulary.
*   **Regional Language:** Word purity, sentence correction, translation.
*   **Excise Laws:** Abkari Act, NDPS Act, Foreign Liquor Rules, COTPA.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus and exam pattern.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Practice previous year question papers.
*   Take mock tests.
*   Stay updated with current affairs.

website_content.title: EMRS Staff Nurse Exam 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## EMRS Staff Nurse Syllabus 2026

The Eklavya Model Residential School (EMRS) under the National Education Society for Tribal Students (NESTS) has released the syllabus for the Staff Nurse Exam 2026.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** EMRS Staff Nurse Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** National Education Society for Tribal Students (NESTS) / EMRS
*   **Post Name:** Staff Nurse
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (Computer-Based Test)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 100
*   **Total Marks:** 100
*   **Exam Duration:**
    *   Prelims: 2 Hours
    *   Mains: 3 Hours
*   **Negative Marking:** No
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam (CBT) + Document Verification
*   **Exam Language:** English / Hindi

**Exam Pattern:**

| Part       | Subject                     | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration | 
|------------|-----------------------------|------------------|-------|----------|
| Part I     | General Awareness / GK       | 10               | 10    | 2 Hours  |
| Part II    | Reasoning Ability           | 15               | 15    |          |
| Part III   | Knowledge of ICT            | 15               | 15    |          |
| Part IV    | Quantitative Aptitude        | 15               | 15    |          |
| Part V     | Language Competency         | 30               | 30    |          |

**Key Topics:**

*   **General Awareness:** Current Affairs, Indian History, Geography, Polity, Economy, Science, Culture, Environment, Sports.
*   **Reasoning:** Analogies, Spatial Orientation, Problem Solving, Coding-Decoding.
*   **ICT:** Computer Basics, MS Office, Internet, Computer Networks.
*   **Nursing Subjects:** Medical-Surgical Nursing, Community Health Nursing, Fundamentals of Nursing, Anatomy & Physiology.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Focus 60-70% time on Nursing Subjects.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Practice previous year papers and mock tests.
*   Stay updated with current affairs.

**Recommended Books:**

*   Textbook of Medical-Surgical Nursing - Brunner & Suddarth
*   Fundamentals of Nursing - Potter & Perry
*   Community Health Nursing - K. Park / BT Basavanthappa
*   Lucent's General Knowledge
*   A Modern Approach to Verbal & Non-Verbal Reasoning - R.S. Aggarwal

website_content.title: NABARD Development Assistant 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## NABARD Development Assistant Syllabus 2026

The National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) has released the syllabus for the Development Assistant Exam 2026 (including Hindi). Candidates can download the syllabus PDF, exam pattern, and marking scheme.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** NABARD Development Assistant Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD)
*   **Post Name:** Development Assistant & Development Assistant (Hindi)
*   **Total Vacancies:** 162
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (CBT)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ) + Descriptive (Mains)
*   **Total Questions:** Prelims: 100; Mains: 150 Objective + 3 Descriptive
*   **Total Marks:** Prelims: 100; Mains: 200
*   **Exam Duration:** Prelims: 60 Minutes; Mains: 135 Minutes
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes (0.25 marks deducted)
*   **Selection Process:** Prelims + Mains + Language Proficiency Test (if applicable)
*   **Exam Language:** English/Hindi
*   **Prelims Date:** 21 Feb 2026
*   **Mains Date:** 12 Apr 2026

**Exam Pattern:**

**Prelims (60 mins):**
*   English Language: 40 Questions (40 Marks)
*   Quantitative Aptitude: 30 Questions (30 Marks)
*   Reasoning Ability: 30 Questions (30 Marks)

**Mains (135 mins):**
*   Test of Reasoning: 30 Questions (30 Marks)
*   Quantitative Aptitude: 30 Questions (30 Marks)
*   General Awareness: 50 Questions (50 Marks)
*   Computer Knowledge: 40 Questions (40 Marks)
*   Descriptive English: 3 Questions (50 Marks)

**Syllabus Topics:** English, Quantitative Aptitude, Reasoning, Computer Knowledge, General Awareness (Agriculture, Rural Development, Banking), Descriptive English.

Download the official syllabus PDF for detailed information.

website_content.markdown_content:
## PEA Police Constable Answer Key 2026 Released!

The Puducherry Examining Authority (PEA) has released the provisional answer key for the Police Constable examination held on **08-02-2026**. Candidates can download the answer key from the official website.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Puducherry Examining Authority (PEA)
*   **Post Name:** Police Constable
*   **Exam Date:** 08-02-2026
*   **Answer Key Status:** Released (08 February 2026)
*   **Last Date for Objection:** 09 February 2026 (As per official notice)
*   **Official Website:** [recruitment.py.gov.in](recruitment.py.gov.in) / [py.gov.in](py.gov.in)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [recruitment.py.gov.in](recruitment.py.gov.in).
2.  Navigate to the "Recruitment" or "Answer Key" section.
3.  Click on "Police Constable Answer Keys and Key Challenge Notice".
4.  Download the PDF.

**How to Raise Objection:**

1.  Visit [recruitment.py.gov.in](recruitment.py.gov.in).
2.  Access the Answer Keys and Key Challenge Notice.
3.  Follow the instructions in the notice.
4.  Submit objections with supporting documents (if required).
5.  Pay any applicable fee.

**Scoring Scheme:**

*   Correct Answer: +1 mark
*   Wrong Answer: -1/4 or 0 (check official notification)
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

website_content.title: HPSC HCS Syllabus 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## HPSC HCS Syllabus 2026 Released!

The Haryana Public Service Commission (HPSC) has released the detailed syllabus for the HCS Exam 2026. Candidates preparing for the HPSC HCS recruitment can download the syllabus PDF, exam pattern, and marking scheme.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** HPSC HCS Examination 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Haryana Public Service Commission (HPSC)
*   **Post Name:** Haryana Civil Services (HCS) & Allied Services
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (Prelims: OMR based, Mains: Descriptive)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (Prelims), Descriptive (Mains)
*   **Total Questions (Prelims):** 200 (100 each paper)
*   **Total Marks (Prelims):** 200
*   **Total Marks (Mains):** 600
*   **Exam Duration (Prelims):** 4 Hours (2+2)
*   **Exam Duration (Mains):** 3 Hours per paper
*   **Selection Process:** Preliminary Exam + Main Written Exam + Interview
*   **Exam Language:** English / Hindi

**Exam Pattern:**

**Prelims:**

| Paper | Subject                      | Marks | Duration |
|-------|------------------------------|-------|----------|
| I     | General Studies              | 100   | 2 Hours  |
| II    | Civil Services Aptitude Test | 100   | 2 Hours  |

**Mains:**

| Paper | Subject                      | Marks | Duration |
|-------|------------------------------|-------|----------|
| I     | English & English Essay      | 100   | 3 Hours  |
| II    | Hindi & Hindi Essay          | 100   | 3 Hours  |
| III   | General Studies I             | 100   | 3 Hours  |
| IV    | General Studies II            | 100   | 3 Hours  |
| V     | General Studies III           | 100   | 3 Hours  |
| VI    | General Studies IV            | 100   | 3 Hours  |

**Key Points:**

*   Prelims is a qualifying test.
*   Mains is descriptive.
*   Interview follows Mains.

Download the official syllabus PDF for detailed subject-wise topics and preparation tips.

website_content.title: JKPSC Assistant Professor Syllabus 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## JKPSC Assistant Professor Syllabus 2026

The Jammu and Kashmir Public Service Commission (JKPSC) has released the syllabus for Assistant Professor positions in Neurosurgery, Medical Oncology, and Urology at SKIMS Soura Srinagar.

**Exam Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** JKPSC Assistant Professor Exam 2026 (Health & Medical Education Department)
*   **Conducting Body:** Jammu and Kashmir Public Service Commission (JKPSC)
*   **Post Name:** Assistant Professor (Neurosurgery, Medical Oncology, and Urology)
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline / Online (Written Examination)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ) / Descriptive
*   **Total Questions/Marks:** Varies by Post (Typically 120 Questions / 120-225 Marks)
*   **Exam Duration:** 2-3 Hours
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes/No (Refer to official notification)
*   **Selection Process:** Written Examination + Interview/Viva-Voce + Document Verification
*   **Exam Language:** English

**Syllabus Overview:**

*   **Neurosurgery:** Neuroanatomy, Neuropathology, Neurotrauma, Vascular Neurosurgery, Skull Base & Spinal Surgery, Pediatric Neurosurgery, Functional & Stereotactic Neurosurgery, Neuro-oncology, Operative Techniques.
*   **Medical Oncology:** Basic Sciences in Oncology, Chemotherapy, Solid Tumors, Hematological Malignancies, Supportive & Palliative Care, Clinical Trials.
*   **Urology:** Anatomy, Urological Imaging, Urinary Tract Infections, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia, Uro-oncology, Andrology, Pediatric Urology, Reconstructive Urology.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Refer to standard postgraduate textbooks.
*   Stay updated with recent advances in journals.
*   Practice MCQs from previous exams.
*   Prepare for the interview (teaching experience, research).

**Recommended Books:**

*   **Neurosurgery:** Youmans and Winn Neurological Surgery
*   **Medical Oncology:** DeVita, Hellman, and Rosenberg's Cancer
*   **Urology:** Campbell-Walsh-Wein Urology

**Download Syllabus PDFs:**

*   [Assistant Professor (Neurosurgery)](Download Here)
*   [Assistant Professor (Medical Oncology)](Download Here)
*   [Assistant Professor (Urology)](Download Here)

website_content.title: BSNL Senior Executive Trainee Recruitment 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## BSNL Senior Executive Trainee Syllabus 2026

The Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) has released the syllabus for the Senior Executive Trainee Exam 2026 (Telecom and Finance Streams).

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** BSNL Senior Executive Trainee Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL)
*   **Post Name:** Senior Executive Trainee (Telecom & Finance Streams)
*   **Total Vacancies:** 120
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (CBT)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 200
*   **Total Marks:** 200
*   **Exam Duration:** 3 Hours
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes (0.25 marks deducted)
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam + Document Verification + Medical Examination
*   **Exam Language:** English

**Exam Pattern:**

| Section                 | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration |
| ----------------------- | ---------------- | ----- | -------- |
| Aptitude Test (Part-I)  | 40               | 40    | 3 Hours  |
| Core Subject (Part-II) | 160              | 160   |          |
| **Total**               | **200**          | **200**|          |

**Syllabus Breakdown:**

*   **General Aptitude (40 Questions):** Decision Making, Reasoning, Arithmetical Ability, etc.
*   **Core Subject (160 Questions):** Varies by stream (Telecom, Finance).
    *   **Telecom Stream:** Network Analysis, Electronics, Digital Circuits, Measurements.
    *   **Finance Stream:** Financial Accounting, Taxation, Companies Act.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus and exam pattern.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Practice previous year papers and mock tests.
*   Focus on accuracy due to negative marking.

**Recommended Books:**

*   Quantitative Aptitude: R.S. Aggarwal
*   Reasoning: R.S. Aggarwal
*   Telecom Engineering: Boylestad / Millman
*   Financial Management: I.M. Pandey

website_content.title: CBSE Class 11 Chemistry Syllabus 2025
website_content.markdown_content:
## CBSE Class 11 Chemistry Syllabus 2025 Released!

The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has officially released the Class 11 Chemistry Syllabus for the academic year 2025. This syllabus provides a comprehensive overview of the fundamental principles of chemistry, blending theoretical knowledge with practical skills.

**Key Highlights:**

*   **Sections:** Theory & Practical
*   **Theory Topics:**
    *   Some Basic Concepts of Chemistry
    *   Structure of Atom
    *   Classification of Elements and Periodicity in Properties
    *   Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structure
    *   States of Matter: Gases and Liquids
    *   Thermodynamics
    *   Equilibrium
    *   Redox Reactions
    *   Hydrocarbons
    *   Environmental Chemistry
*   **Practical Evaluation:**
    *   Volumetric Analysis (08 marks)
    *   Salt Analysis (08 marks)
    *   Content Based Experiment (06 marks)
    *   Project Work (04 marks)
    *   Class record and viva (04 marks)
    *   **Total Practical Marks: 30**

**Class XII (2024-25) Theory Topics:**
*   Solutions
*   Electrochemistry
*   Chemical Kinetics
*   d- and f-Block Elements
*   Coordination Compounds
*   Haloalkanes and Haloarenes
*   Alcohols, Phenols and Ethers
*   Aldehydes, Ketones and Carboxylic Acids
*   Amines
*   Biomolecules

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official CBSE website.
2.  Navigate to the "Curriculum" section under "Academics".
3.  Select "Senior Secondary Curriculum".
4.  Choose the "Class 11" syllabus for the academic year.
5.  Download the Chemistry syllabus PDF.

website_content.title: Rajasthan Livestock Assistant Syllabus 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## Rajasthan Livestock Assistant Syllabus 2026

The Rajasthan Subordinate and Ministerial Services Selection Board (RSMSSB) has released the detailed syllabus for the Livestock Assistant (Pashudhan Sahayak) Exam 2026. 

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** Rajasthan Livestock Assistant Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Rajasthan Subordinate and Ministerial Services Selection Board (RSMSSB)
*   **Post Name:** Livestock Assistant (Pashudhan Sahayak)
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (OMR-based)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 150
*   **Total Marks:** 150
*   **Exam Duration:** 3 Hours
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes (1/3 mark deducted for each wrong answer)
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam + Document Verification
*   **Exam Language:** English/Hindi

**Exam Pattern:**

| Subject/Section                | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration |
| :----------------------------- | :--------------- | :---- | :------- |
| General Knowledge & Current Affairs | 50               | 50    | 3 Hours  |
| Veterinary Science              | 100              | 100   |          |
| **Total**                      | **150**          | **150** |          |

**Syllabus Breakdown:**

*   **Part A: General Knowledge & Current Affairs** (History, Geography, Indian Political System, Economy of Rajasthan, Everyday Science, General Knowledge of Computers, Current Affairs)
*   **Part B: Veterinary Science** (Introductory Veterinary Anatomy, Physiology, Biochemistry, Animal Husbandry Extension, Medicine, Surgery, Nutrition, Management, Breeding, Reproduction, Pharmacology)

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus and exam pattern.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Refer to standard study materials.
*   Practice previous year question papers.
*   Take regular mock tests.
*   Stay updated with current affairs.

**Recommended Books:**

*   Lucent's General Knowledge
*   Rajasthan General Knowledge
*   Textbooks on Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Science
*   Pratiyogita Darpan / Monthly Magazines

website_content.title: TGCET 2026 Hall Ticket Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## TGCET 2026 Hall Ticket Released!

The Telangana Gurukulam Common Entrance Test (TGCET) hall tickets for 2026 are now available for download. This is for admission into Class 5 and backlog vacancies in Classes 6 to 9.

**Important Dates:**

*   Hall Ticket Download Starts: Mid-February 2026
*   Last Date to Download Hall Ticket: Until Exam Date
*   Exam Date: February 22, 2026

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website: tgcet.cgg.gov.in
2.  Find the "Hall Ticket Download" link.
3.  Enter your Candidate ID/Reference ID and Date of Birth (DD-MM-YYYY).
4.  Download and print the PDF (at least two copies).

**Details on Hall Ticket:**

*   Candidate's name and photograph
*   Roll number/Candidate ID
*   Exam date and reporting time
*   Exam center name and address
*   Category and applied class

**Exam Day Instructions:**

*   Carry a printed hall ticket and valid photo ID.
*   Reach the center 30-45 minutes early.
*   Electronic devices are prohibited.
*   Follow any COVID-19 guidelines.

website_content.title: WB ANM GNM Syllabus 2025
website_content.markdown_content:
## WB ANM GNM Syllabus 2025

The West Bengal Joint Entrance Exam Board (WBJEEB) has released the syllabus for the Auxiliary Nurse and Midwifery (ANM) and General Nursing and Midwifery (GNM) programs for 2025. This syllabus is crucial for candidates preparing for admission to these programs in West Bengal.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Pattern:** OMR-based, 100 multiple-choice questions
*   **Duration:** 90 minutes (1.5 hours)
*   **Total Marks:** 115
*   **Category 1:** 1 mark/question, -¼ mark for incorrect answers
*   **Category 2:** 2 marks/question, no negative marking
*   **Languages:** English & Bengali (except Basic English & Logical Reasoning - only in English)

**Subject Breakdown:**

*   **Life Science:** Cellular Organization, Ecology, Diversity of Life Forms, etc. (40 Questions, 50 Marks)
*   **Physical Science:** Matter, Thermal Phenomena, Chemical Calculations, etc. (20 Questions, 25 Marks)
*   **Basic English:** Adjectives, Reading Comprehension, Sentence Correction, etc. (15 Questions, 15 Marks)
*   **Mathematics:** Natural Numbers, Fractions, Percentages, etc. (10 Questions, 10 Marks)
*   **General Knowledge:** States & Capitals, National Symbols, etc. (10 Questions, 10 Marks)
*   **Logical Reasoning:** Puzzles, Syllogisms, Coding-Decoding, etc. (5 Questions, 5 Marks)

**Preparation Tips:**

1.  Prioritize Life Science & Physical Science.
2.  Practice with previous year papers and mock tests.
3.  Use Class 10 NCERT books for core subjects.
4.  Create concise study notes.

**Exam Date:** October 19, 2025

website_content.title: GSSSB Clerk Syllabus 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## GSSSB Clerk Syllabus 2026

The Gujarat Subordinate Service Selection Board (GSSSB) has released the detailed syllabus for the Clerk Exam 2026. This guide covers the exam pattern, marking scheme, and subject-wise topics.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** GSSSB Clerk Exam 2026 (Combined Competitive Exam - Class III)
*   **Conducting Body:** Gujarat Subordinate Service Selection Board (GSSSB)
*   **Post Name:** Clerk (Junior Clerk, Head Clerk, and Other Class-III Posts)
*   **Total Vacancies:** 5370 Posts (Combined for Group A & B)
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (Computer-Based Test)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 100
*   **Total Marks:** 100
*   **Exam Duration:** 1 Hour
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes (0.25 marks deducted for each wrong answer)
*   **Selection Process:** Prelims Exam + Mains Exam + Document Verification
*   **Exam Language:** Gujarati (Parts A, B, D) / English (Part C)

**Exam Pattern (Prelims):**

| Part | Subject             | No. of Questions | Marks | Duration |
|------|---------------------|------------------|-------|----------|
| A    | Reasoning           | 40               | 40    | 1 Hour   |
| B    | Quantitative Aptitude | 30               | 30    |          |
| C    | English             | 15               | 15    |          |
| D    | Gujarati            | 15               | 15    |          |
| Total|                     | 100              | 100   |          |

**Subject-Wise Topics:**

*   **Reasoning:** Problems on Ages, Venn Diagram, Visual Reasoning, Blood Relation, Arithmetic Reasoning, Data Interpretation, Data Sufficiency
*   **Quantitative Aptitude:** Number System, Simplification and Algebra, Arithmetic and Geometric Progression, Average, Percentage, Profit and Loss, Ratio and Proportion, Partnership, Time and Work, Time Speed and Distance
*   **English:** Tenses, Voice, Narration, Use of Articles, Adverb, Noun, Pronoun, Verb, Use of Preposition, Phrasal verbs, Transformations of Sentences, One word Substitution, Synonyms/Antonyms, Comprehension, Jumble words and sentences, Translation
*   **Gujarati:** Translation of Sentences, Fill in the blanks, Antonyms/Synonyms, Error Detection, Comprehension Passage, Vocabulary

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus and exam pattern.
*   Create a realistic study timetable.
*   Practice previous year question papers.
*   Take regular mock tests.
*   Focus on language skills.

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the Provisional Answer Key for JEE Main 2026 Paper 2 (B.Arch & B.Planning). Candidates can download the answer key and their recorded responses from the official website.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Main 2026
*   **Paper:** Paper 2A (B.Arch) & Paper 2B (B.Planning)
*   **Status:** Provisional Answer Key Released
*   **Objection Window:** Open until February 20, 2026 (11:50 PM)
*   **Objection Fee:** ₹200 per question (non-refundable)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official JEE Main website.
2.  Click on the “Answer Key / Recorded Responses” link.
3.  Select Session 1 – January 2026 and your Paper (2A or 2B).
4.  Login using your application number, password/date of birth, and security pin.

**Important Note:** The objection window closes today, February 20, 2026.  Avoid last-minute rush due to potential website traffic.

**Score Calculation:**

*   Correct Answer: +4 marks
*   Incorrect MCQ: -1 mark
*   No negative marking for numerical questions.

website_content.title: AIIMS Paramedical 2025 Syllabus & Exam Pattern Out
website_content.markdown_content:
## AIIMS Paramedical 2025: Important Updates

The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has released the updated syllabus and exam pattern for the AIIMS Paramedical 2025 entrance examination.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** Paramedical (Classes 11 & 12)
*   **Syllabus:** Available for Physics, Chemistry, and Biology.
*   **Exam Pattern:**
    *   Mode: Computer-Based Test (CBT)
    *   Duration: 90 minutes (10:00 AM - 11:30 AM)
    *   Total Questions: 90 (30 Physics, 30 Chemistry, 30 Biology/Mathematics)
    *   Marking Scheme: +1 for correct, -1/3 for incorrect, 0 for unanswered.
    *   Mandatory Sections: Physics & Chemistry. Choose either Biology or Mathematics.

**Subject-wise Topics:**

*   **Physics:** Physical world & measurement, Kinematics, Laws of Motion, Work, Energy, Power, Gravitation, Thermodynamics, Oscillations, Waves, Electrostatics, Current Electricity, Magnetism, Electromagnetic Induction, Alternating Current, Electromagnetic Waves, Optics, Dual Nature of Matter, Atoms, Nuclei, Electronic Devices.
*   **Chemistry:** Basic Concepts, Structure of Atom, Classification of Elements, Chemical Bonding, States of Matter, Thermodynamics, Equilibrium, Redox Reactions, Hydrogen, s-Block, Organic Chemistry, Solid State, Solutions, Electrochemistry, Kinetics, Surface Chemistry, p-Block, d- and f-Block, Coordination Compounds, Haloalkanes, Alcohols, Phenols, Aldehydes, Ketones, Carboxylic Acids, Amines, Biomolecules, Polymers, Chemistry in Everyday Life.
*   **Biology:** Diversity of Living Organisms, Structural Organisation, Cell Structure & Function, Plant Physiology, Human Physiology, Reproduction, Genetics & Evolution, Biology & Human Welfare, Biotechnology, Ecology & Environment.

Download the complete syllabus and exam pattern from the official website.

website_content.title: BIEAP AP Inter 1st Year Hall Ticket 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## BIEAP AP Inter 1st Year Hall Ticket 2026 Released! 

The Board of Intermediate Education Andhra Pradesh (BIEAP) has released the hall tickets for the Inter 1st Year Practical Exams 2026. Candidates can download their hall tickets from the official website.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Name:** Inter 1st Year Public Examination (IPE) 2026
*   **Practical Hall Ticket Status:** Released
*   **Practical Hall Ticket Release Date:** January 24, 2026
*   **Theory Exam Date (Expected):** February 23 to March 25, 2026
*   **Official Website:** bie.ap.gov.in

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website: bie.ap.gov.in
2.  Find the link for "IPE February 2026 Practical Hall Ticket" or "Download Hall Ticket".
3.  Enter your Previous Hall Ticket Number (SSC or First Year details), Aadhaar Number or Date of Birth, and Security Code.
4.  Download and verify all details on the hall ticket.
5.  Save and print 2-3 copies.

**Important Details on Hall Ticket:**

*   Candidate Name
*   Application/Roll Number
*   Date of Birth
*   Category
*   Photograph & Signature

**Exam Day Guidelines:**

*   Reach the exam center 30-45 minutes before reporting time.
*   Carry hall ticket, ID proof, pens, and pencils.
*   Prohibited items: Mobile phones, smartwatches, calculators (unless allowed), textbooks, bags.

website_content.title: GSSSB Class-3 Group-B Answer Key 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## GSSSB Class-3 Group-B Answer Key 2026 Released!

The Gujarat Subordinate Service Selection Board (GSSSB) has released the provisional answer key for the Class-3 Group-B examination held on **12-02-2026**. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** 13 February 2026
*   **Objection Deadline:** 20-02-2026 (23:55)
*   **Exam Date:** 12-02-2026
*   **Organization:** Gujarat Subordinate Service Selection Board (GSSSB)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [gsssb.gujarat.gov.in](gsssb.gujarat.gov.in).
2.  Navigate to the "Answer Key" or "Recruitment" section.
3.  Click on the "GSSSB Class-3 Group-B Answer Key 2026" link.
4.  Log in with your Registration Number and Password/Date of Birth.

**How to Raise Objections:**

1.  Log in to your candidate portal.
2.  Go to the "Challenge/Objection" section.
3.  Select the question(s) to challenge and upload supporting documents (if any).
4.  Pay the objection fee (if applicable).
5.  Submit before **20-02-2026 (23:55)**.

**Scoring:**

Total Score = (Correct Answers × Marks per Question) – (Wrong Answers × Negative Marking)

*   Correct Answer: +X marks
*   Wrong Answer: -X mark
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

## APPSC Thanedar, Executive Officer & Various Posts Answer Key 2026 Released!

The Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission (APPSC) has released the provisional answer key for the Thanedar, Executive Officer Grade-III, Forest Section Officer, Forest Beat Officer & Assistant Beat Officer exam held from February 9-13, 2026.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission (APPSC)
*   **Posts:** Thanedar, Executive Officer Grade-III, Forest Section Officer (FSO), Forest Beat Officer (FBO), Assistant Beat Officer
*   **Exam Dates:** February 9 - 13, 2026
*   **Answer Key Release Date:** February 17, 2026
*   **Objection Deadline:** February 20, 2026
*   **Official Website:** [psc.ap.gov.in](psc.ap.gov.in) / [portal-psc.ap.gov.in](portal-psc.ap.gov.in)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website.
2.  Navigate to the "Keys & Objections" or "Keys to Papers" section.
3.  Click on the relevant "Initial Keys" link.

**How to Raise Objections:**

3.  Select the question(s) to challenge.
4.  Upload supporting documents (if required).
5.  Submit before February 20, 2026.

**Marking Scheme (Typical):**

*   Correct Answer: +1 mark
*   Wrong Answer: -1/3 mark
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

website_content.title: JPSC Drug Inspector Recruitment 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## JPSC Drug Inspector Syllabus 2026

The Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC) has released the detailed syllabus for the Drug Inspector Exam 2026. This is for positions within the Health, Medical Education & Family Welfare Department.

**Key Details:**

*   **Conducting Body:** Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC)
*   **Post Name:** Drug Inspector
*   **Total Vacancies:** 30
*   **Exam Mode:** Offline (Written Examination - Objective)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Marks:** 1000 (200 Marks per Paper)
*   **Exam Duration:** 2 Hours per Paper
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam + Interview / Viva-Voce + Document Verification
*   **Exam Language:** English / Hindi

**Exam Pattern:**

| Paper / Section | Subject                               | No. of Marks | Duration |
|-----------------|---------------------------------------|--------------|----------|
| Paper I         | Pharmaceutics / General Medicine      | 200          | 2 Hours  |
| Paper II        | Microbiology                          | 200          | 2 Hours  |
| Paper III       | Pharmacology                          | 200          | 2 Hours  |
| Paper IV        | Pharmaceutical Chemistry / Biochemistry | 200          | 2 Hours  |
| Paper V         | Pharmaceutical Jurisprudence & Ethics | 200          | 2 Hours  |
| **Total**       |                                       | **1000**     | **10 Hours** |

**Important Topics:**
* Drugs & Cosmetics Act 1940 & Rules 1945
* Pharmaceutical Jurisprudence & Ethics
* Pharmacology & Drug Actions
* Medicinal Chemistry & SAR
* Jharkhand-specific Current Affairs & GK

**Resources:**
*   Refer to standard textbooks and previous year papers.
*   Practice MCQs daily.
*   Stay updated with the JPSC website for exam dates and admit cards.

**Note:** Always download the latest official notification / syllabus PDF from the official website for the complete and updated syllabus.

website_content.markdown_content:
## UPSSSC Enforcement Constable PET Admit Card 2026 OUT!

The Uttar Pradesh Subordinate Services Selection Commission (UPSSSC) has released the admit card for the Enforcement Constable (Pravartan Sipahi) Physical Efficiency Test (PET) and Physical Standards Test (PST) on **February 16, 2026**. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** February 16, 2026
*   **PET/PST Date:** February 22, 2026
*   **Location:** Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh
*   **Total Vacancies:** 477 Posts
*   **Advertisement No.:** 04-Exam/2023

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website: upsssc.gov.in
2.  Navigate to the "Download Admit Card" section.
3.  Enter your Registration Number, Date of Birth/Password, and Verification Code.
4.  Download and print the admit card (2-3 copies recommended).

**Important Instructions:**

*   Carry a printed copy of the admit card and a valid photo ID.
*   Mobile phones and electronic devices are prohibited.
*   Physical tests include a 4.8 km run for males (in 27 minutes) and a 2.4 km run for females (in 16 minutes).

**Important Dates:**

*   Application Start Date: July 7, 2023 (Completed)
*   Application Last Date: July 28, 2023 (Completed)
*   Written Exam Date: May 11, 2025 (Completed)
*   Result Declaration: November 13, 2025 (Completed)
*   PET Admit Card Release Date: February 16, 2026 (Live Now)
*   PET/PST Date: February 22, 2026 (Upcoming)

**Scoring:**

Total Score = (Correct Answers × Marks per Question) – (Wrong Answers × Negative Marking)

*   Correct Answer: +X marks
*   Wrong Answer: -X mark
*   Unattempted: 0 marks
