website_content.title: PSSSB Clerk Recruitment 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## PSSSB Clerk Syllabus 2026

The Punjab Subordinate Services Selection Board (PSSSB) has released the detailed syllabus for the Clerk Exam 2026. This guide covers the exam pattern, marking scheme, and subject-wise topics.

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** PSSSB Clerk Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Punjab Subordinate Services Selection Board (PSSSB)
*   **Post Name:** Clerk
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (Computer-Based Test)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 150
*   **Total Marks:** 150
*   **Exam Duration:** 150 Minutes
*   **Negative Marking:** Yes - 0.25 marks deducted for each wrong answer
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam (CBT) + Document Verification + Typing Test (if applicable)
*   **Exam Language:** English / Punjabi

**Exam Pattern:**

| Subject/Section             | No. of Questions | Marks | 
| --------------------------- | ---------------- | ----- |
| General Knowledge / Awareness | 25               | 25    |
| Punjab History and Culture   | 17               | 17    |
| Logical Reasoning            | 25               | 25    |
| Punjabi Language             | 50               | 50    |
| Punjabi                     | 13               | 13    |
| English                     | 12               | 12    |
| ICT                         | 08               | 08    |
| **Total**                   | **150**          | **150** |

**Key Topics:**

*   **General Knowledge:** Current Affairs, Indian History, Geography, Polity, Economy, Science, Punjab GK.
*   **Logical Reasoning:** Analogies, Puzzles, Coding-Decoding.
*   **Mathematics:** Percentage, Ratio, Profit & Loss.
*   **Punjabi:** Grammar, Muhavare, Vakyansh.
*   **English:** Comprehension, Error Detection, Vocabulary.

**Preparation Tips:**

*   Understand the syllabus and exam pattern.
*   Create a study timetable.
*   Practice previous year papers.
*   Take mock tests.
*   Focus on Punjab GK and Punjabi.

website_content.markdown_content:
## IBPS RRB PO Final Result 2026 OUT! 

The Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) has released the final result (Provisional Allotment) for RRB Officer Scale-I (PO), Scale-II & Scale-III posts on **February 23, 2026**. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Recruiting Body:** Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS)
*   **Post Name:** RRB Officer Scale-I (PO), Scale-II & Scale-III
*   **Result Type:** Final Result (Provisional Allotment - Combined Mains + Interview)
*   **Declaration Date:** February 23, 2026
*   **Selection Stages:** Prelims → Mains → Interview → Provisional Allotment
*   **Official Website:** [www.ibps.in](www.ibps.in)

**How to Check Your Result:**

1.  Visit the official website: www.ibps.in
2.  Navigate to the "CRP RRBs XIV" or "Current Openings/Results" section.
3.  Click on the link for "Result for CRP RRBs-XIV (Provisional Allotment)" or "Final Result Officers Scale-I/II/III".
4.  Enter your Registration Number/Roll Number and Password/Date of Birth.
5.  Submit and download your scorecard/PDF.

**Merit List Information:**

*   Separate merit lists are available for different categories and scales.
*   Merit lists include Registration Number/Roll Number, Candidate Name, Category, Combined Final Marks, Provisional Allotment Status, Allotted RRB, Rank, and Qualifying Status.

**Scorecard Information:**

*   Your scorecard will display Candidate Name, Registration/Roll Number, Combined Marks, Normalized scores, Final Score, Qualifying Status, Category Rank, and Allotted RRB.

**Important Instructions:**

*   Download and save your scorecard immediately.
*   Prepare for document verification at your allotted RRB.
*   Keep all original documents ready.

website_content.title: HPCL Engineer Recruitment 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## HPCL Engineer Syllabus 2026

Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) has released the detailed syllabus and exam pattern for Engineer posts in various disciplines for recruitment 2026. 

**Exam Overview:**

*   **Exam Name:** HPCL Engineer Exam 2026
*   **Conducting Body:** Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL)
*   **Post Name:** Engineer (Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Industrial, etc.)
*   **Exam Mode:** Online (Computer-Based Test - CBT)
*   **Exam Type:** Objective (MCQ)
*   **Total Questions:** 170
*   **Total Marks:** 170
*   **Exam Duration:** 150 Minutes (2 Hours 30 Minutes)
*   **Negative Marking:** No Negative Marking
*   **Selection Process:** CBT + Group Task + Interview
*   **Exam Language:** English

**Syllabus Breakdown:**

*   **Section I (85 Questions, 85 Marks):** General Aptitude (Logical Reasoning, Quantitative Aptitude, English Language)
*   **Section II (85 Questions, 85 Marks):** Technical / Professional Knowledge (Discipline-specific - Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Instrumentation, Chemical)

**Key Topics:**

*   **General Aptitude:** Data Interpretation, Logical Reasoning, Reading Comprehension, Percentage & Ratio
*   **Technical:** Core subjects from respective engineering branch (focus on numerical & conceptual questions).

**Important Note:** Always refer to the official notification on [hindustanpetroleum.com](https://hindustanpetroleum.com) for the most up-to-date syllabus and exam pattern.

**Download Syllabus PDFs:**

*   [HPCL Chemical Engineering Syllabus 2026 PDF](link_placeholder_chemical)
*   [HPCL Civil Engineering Syllabus 2026 PDF](link_placeholder_civil)
*   [HPCL Electrical Engineering Syllabus 2026 PDF](link_placeholder_electrical)
*   [HPCL Mechanical Engineering Syllabus 2026 PDF](link_placeholder_mechanical)
*   [HPCL Industrial Engineering Syllabus 2026 PDF](link_placeholder_industrial)

website_content.markdown_content:
## DSSSB SSA (Chemistry) Result 2026 OUT! 

The Delhi Subordinate Services Selection Board (DSSSB) has released the result for the Senior Scientific Assistant (Chemistry) – Post Code 17/25 on **20 February 2026**. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Recruiting Body:** DSSSB
*   **Post Name:** Senior Scientific Assistant (Chemistry) / SSA (Chemistry) - Post Code 17/25
*   **Result Type:** Written Examination Result / Shortlisted Candidates Notice
*   **Declaration Date:** 20 February 2026
*   **Exam Date:** 11 December 2025 (Multiple Shifts)
*   **Selection Stages:** Written Test (Tier-I) → Document Verification / E-Dossier → Further Process
*   **Official Website:** [dsssb.delhi.gov.in](dsssb.delhi.gov.in)

**How to Check:**

1.  Visit [dsssb.delhi.gov.in](dsssb.delhi.gov.in).
2.  Go to the 'Latest Result' section.
3.  Find NOTICE NO: 134 - POST: SENIOR SCIENTIFIC ASSISTANT (CHEMISTRY) POST CODE-17/25.
4.  Download the PDF result notice.
5.  Search for your Roll Number / Name.
6.  Login to OARS module ([dsssbonline.nic.in](dsssbonline.nic.in)) for marks/scorecard (if available).

**Merit List Information:**
The merit list contains Roll Number, Candidate Name, Father's Name, Category, Marks Obtained, and Qualifying Status. Separate lists are available for reserved categories and a waiting list may be prepared.

website_content.markdown_content:
## KRCL Trainee Apprentices Recruitment 2026

Konkan Railway Corporation Limited (KRCL) is seeking applications for Trainee Apprentices under the Apprentices Act, 1961/1973. This is a one-year training opportunity for Graduate and Technician Apprentices who passed out between 2021-2025.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Konkan Railway Corporation Limited (KRCL)
*   **Post Name:** Trainee Apprentices (Graduate/Technician)
*   **No. of Vacancies:** 190
*   **Job Type:** Apprenticeship Training
*   **Training Duration:** 1 Year
*   **Qualification:** BE/BTech/Diploma in relevant Engineering Branches or General Graduation (Passed 2021-2025)
*   **Application Mode:** Online
*   **Selection Process:** Merit List (Aggregate Marks), Document Verification
*   **Job Location:** Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka

**Important Dates:**

*   **Notification Release:** 20/02/2026
*   **Online Application Start:** 20/02/2026
*   **Last Date to Apply:** 21/03/2026

**Vacancy Breakdown:**

*   Civil Engineering: 30
*   Electrical Engineering: 20
*   Electronics Engineering: 10
*   Mechanical Engineering: 20
*   Diploma (Civil): 30
*   Diploma (Electrical): 20
*   Diploma (Electronics): 10
*   Diploma (Mechanical): 20
*   General Stream Graduates: 30

**Eligibility Criteria:**

*   **Age Limit:** 18-25 years (Relaxation applicable for SC/ST/OBC-NCL)
*   Valid NATS ID required.
*   No prior/current apprenticeship.

**Application Fee:**

*   ₹100 for General/OBC-NCL/EWS
*   Nil for SC/ST/Female/Minorities

**Stipend:**

*   Graduate Apprentices: ₹9,000/month
*   Technician (Diploma) Apprentices: ₹8,000/month

website_content.markdown_content:
## MPESB Group 1 Sub Group 2 Answer Key 2026 Released

The Madhya Pradesh Employees Selection Board (MPESB) has released the provisional answer key for the Group 1 Sub Group 2 examination held on **17 February 2026**. Candidates can download the answer key PDF from the official website.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Madhya Pradesh Employees Selection Board (MPESB)
*   **Post Name:** Group 1 Sub Group 2
*   **Total Vacancies:** 474
*   **Exam Date:** 17 February 2026
*   **Answer Key Release Date:** 23 February 2026
*   **Last Date to Raise Objection:** 26 February 2026
*   **Objection Fee:** ₹XX per question (refundable if accepted)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website: esb.mp.gov.in
2.  Navigate to the "Answer Key" or "Recruitment" section.
3.  Click on the "Group 1 Sub Group 2 Answer Key 2026" link.
4.  Log in using your Registration Number and Password/Date of Birth.
5.  Download and save the PDF.

**How to Raise Objection:**

1.  Log in to your candidate portal on esb.mp.gov.in
2.  Go to the "Challenge/Objection" section.
3.  Select the question(s) you want to challenge.
4.  Upload supporting documents (if required).
5.  Pay the objection fee.
6.  Submit before the deadline.

website_content.markdown_content:
## RPSC Junior Chemist & Assistant Electrical Inspector Answer Key 2026 Released! 

The Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC) has released the answer key for the Junior Chemist and Assistant Electrical Inspector examination held on **February 1, 2026**. Candidates can download the answer key PDF from the official website.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC)
*   **Post Name:** Junior Chemist & Assistant Electrical Inspector
*   **Total Vacancies:** 22
*   **Exam Date:** February 1, 2026
*   **Answer Key Released:** February 23, 2026
*   **Objection Last Date:** February 27, 2026

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [rpsc.rajasthan.gov.in](rpsc.rajasthan.gov.in).
2.  Navigate to the "Answer Key" or "Recruitment" section.
3.  Click on the relevant answer key link.
4.  Log in with your Registration Number and Password/Date of Birth (if required).
5.  Download and save the PDF.

**Objection Process:**

1.  Log in to your candidate portal on rpsc.rajasthan.gov.in.
2.  Go to the "Challenge/Objection" section.
3.  Select the question(s) to challenge.
4.  Upload supporting documents (if required).
5.  Pay the objection fee (if applicable).
6.  Submit before February 27, 2026.

**Scoring:**

Total Score = (Correct Answers × Marks per Question) – (Wrong Answers × Negative Marking)

website_content.markdown_content:
## Pune City Police Constable & Driver Result 2026

The Pune City Police has released the Physical Efficiency Test (PET) score sheets for Constable (including female candidates) and Driver posts for the 2024-2025 recruitment cycle on **February 23, 2026**. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Recruiting Body:** Pune City Police
*   **Post Name:** Police Constable and Driver
*   **Result Type:** Physical Efficiency Test (PET) Score Sheet
*   **Declaration Date:** February 23, 2026
*   **Selection Stages:** Physical Test (PET/PST) → Written Exam → Document Verification → Final Merit
*   **Official Website:** [punepolice.gov.in](punepolice.gov.in)

**How to Check Your Result:**

1.  Visit the official website: [punepolice.gov.in](punepolice.gov.in)
2.  Navigate to the "Police Recruitment" or "पोलिस भरती" section.
3.  Find the latest notices or result links.
4.  Click on the relevant PDF link for Constable/Driver physical test scores.
5.  Search for your Application ID / Chest No. / Name in the PDF.

**Scorecard Information:**

*   Serial Number / Chest No.
*   Application ID
*   Candidate Name
*   Gender
*   Scores in Shotput, 800m Run, 100m Run (or relevant events)
*   Total Marks (out of 50)
*   Performance Status

**Important Instructions:**

*   Download and save the PDF score sheets.
*   Keep checking the official website for written exam call letters and further updates.

## BNRC ANM/GNM Result 2026 Announced!

The Bihar Nurses Registration Council (BNRC), Patna, has released the results for the GNM (General Nursing and Midwifery) and ANM (Auxiliary Nurse Midwife) courses for the year 2026.

**Key Details:**

*   **Conducting Body:** Bihar Nurses Registration Council (BNRC), Patna
*   **Courses:** GNM, ANM and other BNRC-regulated nursing courses
*   **Result Year:** 2026
*   **Mode of Result:** Online
*   **Official Result Website:** [bnrcresult.com](bnrcresult.com)
*   **Official Main Website:** [bnrc.bihar.gov.in](bnrc.bihar.gov.in)

**How to Check Your Result:**

1.  Visit the official result website: [bnrcresult.com](bnrcresult.com)
2.  Navigate to the “Results” section.
3.  Select your course (GNM or ANM) and year/part.
4.  Enter your Roll Number and other required details.
5.  Download your mark sheet PDF.

**Details on Marksheet:**

*   Student’s full name
*   Roll number / registration number
*   Course name (GNM / ANM)
*   Year / part
*   Name of the nursing institute
*   Subject-wise marks
*   Total marks and maximum marks
*   Result status (Pass / Fail)
*   Exam session

For any discrepancies, contact your institute or BNRC through official channels.

website_content.title: OPSC AAO Answer Key 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## OPSC AAO Answer Key 2026 Released!

The Odisha Public Service Commission (OPSC) has released the provisional answer key for the Assistant Agriculture Officer (AAO) exam held on **19 February 2026** (Paper I: 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM; Paper II: 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM).

**Key Details:**

*   **Total Vacancies:** 118
*   **Answer Key Release Date:** 23 February 2026
*   **Objection Deadline:** 2 March 2026 (12:00 Noon)
*   **Exam Date:** 19 February 2026

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [www.opsc.gov.in](www.opsc.gov.in)
2.  Navigate to the "What’s New" or "Latest Updates" section.
3.  Click on the "OPSC AAO Answer Key 2026" link.
4.  Download the PDF for Sets A, B, C, and D.

**How to Raise Objections:**

1.  Visit [http://opscechayan.in](http://opscechayan.in)
2.  Log in to your candidate portal.
3.  Go to the "Objection / Suggestion" section.
4.  Select the question(s) and provide justification.
5.  Submit before the deadline: 2 March 2026 (12:00 Noon).

**Marking Scheme:**

*   Correct Answer: +1 mark
*   Wrong Answer: -0.25 mark
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

## HPCL Graduate Apprentice Trainees Recruitment 2026-27 (Refineries Division)

Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) - Refineries Division is seeking Graduate Apprentice Trainees in Engineering streams under the Apprentices Act, 1961.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) - Refineries Division
*   **Post Name:** Graduate Apprentice Trainees (Engineering)
*   **Total Vacancies:** 250
*   **Job Type:** Apprenticeship Training
*   **Training Duration:** 1 Year
*   **Qualification:** BE/BTech in relevant discipline (Passed after 01.04.2023)
*   **Application Mode:** Online
*   **Selection Process:** Merit-Based Screening, Document Verification
*   **Job Location:** Mumbai Refinery (Maharashtra), Visakh Refinery (Andhra Pradesh)

**Important Dates:**

*   **Notification Release:** Prior to 25 February 2026
*   **Online Application Start:** 25 February 2026
*   **Last Date to Apply:** 10 March 2026

**Vacancy Breakdown:**

*   Mumbai Refinery - Maharashtra: 120
*   Visakh Refinery - Andhra Pradesh: 130

**Eligibility Criteria:**

*   Full-time Engineering Graduation from AICTE/UGC recognized university.
*   Completed after 01.04.2023.
*   Minimum Marks: 60% (UR/OBC-NC/EWS), 50% (SC/ST/PwBD).
*   Age Limit (as on 10.03.2026): 18-25 years (Relaxation applicable).

**Stipend:** ₹25,000 per month (₹20,500 by HPCL + ₹4,500 by GOI).

**How to Apply:**

1.  Register on NATS 2.0 portal and get BOAT approval.
2.  Apply online through the HPCL recruitment portal.

website_content.title: CGPSC SSE Answer Key 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## CGPSC SSE Answer Key 2026 Released!

The Chhattisgarh Public Service Commission (CGPSC) has released the provisional answer key for the State Service Examination (SSE) 2026 preliminary exam.

**Key Details:**

*   **Exam Date:** 22nd February 2026
*   **Answer Key Release Date:** 23rd February 2026
*   **Objection Deadline:** 3rd March 2026
*   **Total Vacancies:** 239
*   **Objection Fee:** ₹50 per question (refundable if accepted)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [psc.cg.gov.in](psc.cg.gov.in)
2.  Navigate to the "Model Answer" or "Answer Key" section.
3.  Download the PDF.

**How to Raise an Objection:**

1.  Visit [psc.cg.gov.in](psc.cg.gov.in)
2.  Log in to your candidate portal (if required).
3.  Go to the "Objection" or "Challenge" section.
4.  Select the question(s) and upload supporting documents.
5.  Pay the objection fee and submit before the deadline.

**Marking Scheme:**

*   Correct Answer: +2 marks
*   Wrong Answer: -0.66 mark
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

website_content.title: KMAT Answer Key 2026 Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## KMAT Answer Key 2026 – Download Now!

The KMAT Answer Key 2026 has been released in provisional format for the Session 1 exam held on February 22, 2026. Candidates can download the key to estimate their scores.

**Important Dates:**

*   **Exam Date:** February 22, 2026
*   **Answer Key Release:** February 23, 2026
*   **Objection Window:** Open until notified (check official notice)
*   **Final Answer Key:** After scrutiny of objections (date to be notified)
*   **Result:** Within 2-3 weeks after the exam

**Exam Pattern:**

*   **Total Questions:** 180
*   **Total Marks:** 720
*   **Duration:** 180 minutes
*   **Sections:** English, Quantitative Aptitude, Data Sufficiency & Logical Reasoning, General Knowledge & Current Affairs

**Marking Scheme:** +4 for correct answers, potential negative marking (-1, confirm in official bulletin).

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [cee.kerala.gov.in](cee.kerala.gov.in)
2.  Navigate to “Present Active Links” and click on KMAT 2026.
3.  Click on “Answer Key”.
4.  Download the PDF.

**Objection Process:**

Candidates can challenge the provisional answer key with supporting documentation within the specified timeframe. A fee may apply.

**Key Tips:**

*   Use only the official answer key from CEE, Kerala.
*   Focus on section-wise performance.

The Central Selection Board of Constable (CSBC), Bihar, is recruiting for 993 Constable (Operator) positions in the Bihar Police Radio Organization.

**Key Details:**

*   **Organization:** Central Selection Board of Constable (CSBC), Bihar
*   **Post Name:** Constable (Operator) [Sipahi (Prachalak)]
*   **Vacancies:** 993 (Provisional)
*   **Pay Scale:** ₹21,700 - ₹69,100 (Level-3)
*   **Eligibility:** 10+2 (Intermediate) in Science with Physics, Chemistry, Math (50% marks, 45% for SC/ST)
*   **Application Mode:** Online
*   **Selection Process:** Written Exam, Physical Efficiency Test (PET), Document Verification
*   **Job Location:** Bihar

**Important Dates:**

*   **Notification Release:** February 2026
*   **Online Application Start:** March 1, 2026
*   **Last Date to Apply:** March 31, 2026

**Application Fee:** ₹100 + bank charges

**Age Limit (as of 01.08.2026):**

*   Minimum: 18 years
*   Maximum: 25 years (Unreserved), 27 years (Backward/EBC Males), 28 years (Backward/EBC Females), 30 years (SC/ST/Transgender)

**Physical Standards:**

*   **Height:** Males (UR/BC: 165cm, EBC/ST: 160cm), Females: 155cm

*   **Weight (Females):** Minimum 48 kg

**Written Exam:** 100 marks, 100 questions, 2 hours (Intermediate level syllabus).

**PET:** Running, High Jump, Shot Put (Qualifying).

**Don't forget to check the official notification for detailed information!**

website_content.title: AIBE 20 Rechecking Result 2026 Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## AIBE 20 Rechecking Result 2026 – Key Details

The Bar Council of India has released the AIBE 20 rechecking result for candidates who applied for re-evaluation of their OMR sheets. Candidates can check their status using their registered credentials.

**Exam Name:** All India Bar Examination (AIBE 20 / AIBE XX) – 2025 cycle
**Conducting Body:** Bar Council of India (BCI)
**Exam Date:** 30 November 2025
**Original Result Date:** 7 January 2026
**Rechecking Application Window:** 14 January 2026 – 23 January 2026
**Rechecking Fee:** ₹500 (non-refundable)
**Rechecking Mode:** Online OMR sheet/result rechecking

**Important Dates:**

| Event | Date |
|---|---| 
| AIBE 20 exam date | 30 November 2025 |
| Declaration of AIBE 20 result | 7 January 2026 |
| Opening of OMR rechecking window | 14 January 2026 |
| Last date to apply for rechecking | 23 January 2026 |
| AIBE 20 rechecking result 2026 | Released |

**How to Check Your Result:**

1.  Visit the official AIBE website: allindiabarexamination.com.
2.  Click on the “Rechecking Result AIBE-XX” / “AIBE 20 Result Rechecking” link.
3.  Enter your user ID, password, and captcha code.
4.  Login to view your result.

**What is Checked During Rechecking?**

*   Verification of correct OMR scanning.
*   Confirmation of marked answers.
*   Total marks tally with the official answer key.

**Note:** Rechecking does *not* involve re-evaluation or changing marked answers.

**After the Result:**

*   **Pass:** Proceed with the Certificate of Practice (COP) process.
*   **Unchanged:** Original result remains final; no refund of the rechecking fee.

**Official Websites:**

*   [AIBE Official Website](allindiabarexamination.com)

## MJP Various Posts Admit Card 2026 OUT!

Maharashtra Jeevan Pradhikaran (MJP) has released the admit cards for various posts (Advt No. 01/2025). Candidates can download their hall tickets from the official website.

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** 23 February 2026
*   **Exam Date:** 25-27 February 2026
*   **Total Vacancies:** 299 Posts
*   **Advertisement No.:** 01/2025

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website: mjp.maharashtra.gov.in
2.  Navigate to the "Recruitment" or "Latest Announcements" section.
3.  Click on the "MJP Various Posts Admit Card 2026" link.
4.  Enter your Registration Number/Application Number, Date of Birth/Password, and Captcha Code.
5.  Download and print the admit card.

**Important Documents to Carry:**

*   Admit Card (printed copy)

**Important Instructions:**

*   Reach the exam center 45-60 minutes before reporting time.
*   Entry closes 30 minutes before the exam.
*   Do not carry mobile phones, smartwatches, calculators, or prohibited items.

**Important Dates:**

*   Notification Date: 05 November 2025
*   Application Start Date: 20 November 2025
*   Application Last Date: 26 December 2025
*   Admit Card Release Date: 23 February 2026

website_content.title: IIT JAM 2026 Answer Key Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## IIT JAM 2026 Answer Key – Important Updates

The provisional answer key for IIT JAM 2026 has been released by IIT Bombay on February 24, 2026. Candidates can download it from the JOAPS portal at [joaps.iitb.ac.in](joaps.iitb.ac.in).

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** February 24, 2026
*   **Objection Window:** Open until 11:59:59 PM on February 27, 2026
*   **Result Date:** March 20, 2026
*   **Objection Fee:** Typically ₹500 per question (refundable if accepted)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit [jam2026.iitb.ac.in](jam2026.iitb.ac.in).
2.  Login to JOAPS using your Enrolment ID/Registered Email ID and Password.
3.  Navigate to the Answer Key/Response Sheet section.
4.  Download the subject-wise answer key PDF.

**Score Calculation:**

*   **Section A (MCQs):** 10 x 1 mark + 20 x 2 marks (-1/3 negative marking for wrong answers)
*   **Section B (MSQs):** No negative marking
*   **Section C (NAT):** No negative marking

**Important Dates:**

*   **Registration Start:** September 05, 2025
*   **Registration Last Date:** October 12, 2025
*   **Admit Card:** January 05, 2026
*   **Exam Date:** February 15, 2026

**Key Details:**

*   **Post Name:** TGT (Non Medical) - Post Code 25002
*   **Result Type:** CBT Screening Test Result (Merit List PDF)
*   **Result Date:** February 24, 2026

*   **Selection Stages:** CBT → Document Verification
*   **Total Vacancies:** 343

**How to Check:**

1.  Visit the official website: hprca.hp.gov.in
2.  Navigate to the 'Latest' section.
3.  Click on the link for the result of the CBT for TGT (Non Medical) Post Code-25002 (dated February 24, 2026).

website_content.title: TBSE Class 10 & 12 Admit Card 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## TBSE Class 10 & 12 Admit Card 2026 - Important Information

The Tripura Board of Secondary Education (TBSE) will release the admit cards for Madhyamik (Class 10) and Higher Secondary (Class 12) board examinations 2026. Here's a breakdown of key details:

**Key Details:**

*   **Board:** Tripura Board of Secondary Education (TBSE)
*   **Exams:** TBSE Madhyamik (Class 10) & Higher Secondary (Class 12) Board Examinations 2026
*   **Release Mode:** Offline - via schools
*   **Classes Covered:** Class 10 & Class 12
*   **Admit Card Status:** Class 10 released through schools; Class 12 to be issued to schools.
*   **Website:** [tbse.tripura.gov.in](tbse.tripura.gov.in)

**How to Obtain:**

*   **Schools:** Download from [tbse.tripura.gov.in](tbse.tripura.gov.in) using school credentials.
*   **Students:** Collect from your respective school.

**Details on Admit Card:**

*   Student Name
*   Roll Number & Registration Number
*   Class & Stream (for Class 12)
*   School Name & Code
*   Exam Centre Details
*   Subject Codes & Exam Dates
*   Candidate Photograph

**Important Guidelines:**

*   Carry original admit card & school ID.
*   Prohibited items: Mobile phones, smartwatches, calculators (unless allowed).
*   Report to the exam centre 30-60 minutes before reporting time.

**In case of errors:** Immediately inform your school.

website_content.markdown_content:
## UP Police SI/ASI Transcription Admit Card 2026 Released

The Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment and Promotion Board (UPPRPB) has released the admit card for the SI (Confidential), ASI (Clerk), and ASI (Accounts) transcription (stenography/shorthand) test for the 2023 recruitment cycle.

**Key Details:**

*   **Release Date:** 24 February 2026
*   **Exam Date:** 28 February 2026
*   **Total Vacancies:** 921 Posts
*   **Posts:** SI (Confidential), ASI (Clerk), ASI (Accounts)
*   **Official Website:** uppbpb.gov.in

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official UPPRPB website: uppbpb.gov.in
2.  Navigate to the "Latest News/Notice" or "Admit Card" section.
3.  Click on the link for "UP Police SI ASI Transcription Admit Card 2026".
4.  Enter your Registration Number, Date of Birth, and Captcha Code.
5.  Download and print the admit card (2-3 copies recommended).

**Important Documents to Carry:**

*   Admit Card (printed copy)
*   Valid Photo ID Proof (Aadhaar, Voter ID, Driving License, PAN Card, Passport)
*   Recent passport-size photographs (2 copies)

**Important Instructions:**

*   Reach the exam center 45-60 minutes before reporting time.
*   Entry closes 30 minutes before the exam.
*   Do not carry mobile phones, smartwatches, or any prohibited items.

*   **Post Name:** Group-D
*   **Total Vacancies:** Anticipated posts (as per departmental requisitions till 30/09/2026)

*   **Salary:** ₹18,000 - ₹56,900 (Level-1 as per 7th CPC)

*   Negative marking of 1/4 marks for incorrect answers.

website_content.markdown_content:
## TNPSC APP Answer Key 2026

The Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) has released the provisional answer key for the Assistant Public Prosecutor Grade-II examination held on February 15, 2026. 

**Key Details:**

*   **Post Name:** Assistant Public Prosecutor Grade-II
*   **Total Vacancies:** 61
*   **Exam Date:** February 15, 2026
*   **Answer Key Status:** Released (Provisional)
*   **Release Date:** February 24, 2026
*   **Last Date for Objection:** March 03, 2026 (5:45 PM)

**How to Download:**

1.  Visit the official website: [www.tnpsc.gov.in](www.tnpsc.gov.in)
2.  Navigate to the "Answer Key" or "Recruitment" section.
3.  Click on the "TNPSC APP Answer Key 2026" link.
4.  Log in using your Application Number and Date of Birth.

**How to Raise Objection:**

1.  Log in to your candidate portal on [www.tnpsc.gov.in](www.tnpsc.gov.in).
2.  Go to the "Answer Key Challenge" or "Objection" section.
3.  Select the question(s) you want to challenge.
4.  Upload supporting documents (if required).
5.  Submit before March 03, 2026.

**Important Dates:**

*   Exam Conducted: February 15, 2026
*   Answer Key Released: February 24, 2026
*   Objection Deadline: March 03, 2026
*   Final Answer Key (Expected): March/April 2026

**Marking Scheme:**

*   Correct Answer: +1 mark
*   Wrong Answer: No negative marking
*   Unattempted: 0 marks

The Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) has released the hall ticket for the Combined Technical Services Examination (Interview Posts) – 2026.

*   **Release Date:** 25 February 2026
*   **Exam Date:** 7 & 8 March 2026 (Forenoon & Afternoon sessions)
*   **Total Vacancies:** 76 Posts
*   **Advertisement No.:** 19/2025

1.  Visit the official website: tnpsc.gov.in or apply.tnpscexams.in

**Important Instructions:**

*   Check all details on the hall ticket immediately after download.

*   Reach the exam center 60 minutes before reporting time.
*   Entry closes 30 minutes before the exam starts.

website_content.markdown_content:
## HPBOSE Class 12th Admit Card 2026 – Latest Update

The Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education has released the HPBOSE Class 12th Admit Card 2026 for schools to download via the official portal [hpbose.org](http://hpbose.org).

**Key Dates:**

| Event | Date |
|---|---| 
| Release of HPBOSE Class 12th Date Sheet 2026 | 26 November 2025 |
| Practical Exams | 2 February 2026 – 28 February 2026 |
| Admit Card Release (School Login) | February 2026 |
| Theory Exams | 3 March 2026 – 1 April 2026 |
| Expected Result | May 2026 (Tentative) |

**How to Download (For Schools):**

1.  Visit [hpbose.org](http://hpbose.org).
2.  Click on “Online Services” then “School Login”.
3.  Enter school credentials.
4.  Navigate to the Class 12 admit card section.
5.  Download the PDF, print, sign, and stamp before distributing to students.

**Important Notes:**

*   Students cannot download directly; only schools have access.
*   Verify all details on the admit card (name, photo, subject, dates).
*   Carry the *original* admit card to the exam.
*   Prohibited items: mobile phones, smartwatches, etc.
*   Report to the exam center 30 minutes before the reporting time.

website_content.markdown_content:
## UP DElEd 1st & 3rd Semester Result 2026 Announced!

The Examination Regulatory Authority, Prayagraj (PNP) has officially declared the UP DElEd 1st and 3rd Semester Results for 2026.

**Key Dates:**

*   **1st Semester Exam:** October 27–29, 2025
*   **3rd Semester Exam:** October 30–November 1, 2025
*   **Result Uploaded:** February 2026 (Declared February 25-26, 2026)

**About UP DElEd:**

UP DElEd (Diploma in Elementary Education) is a two-year diploma program for aspiring primary teachers in Uttar Pradesh.

**Pass Percentage:**

Approximately 50-58% pass rate across sessions (around 242,306 passes out of 419,095 candidates).

**How to Check Your Result:**

1.  Visit the official portal: [btcresult.in](btcresult.in) (also check [updeled.gov.in](updeled.gov.in), [updeledinfo.in](updeledinfo.in) or [updeledexam.in](updeledexam.in))
2.  Find the “D.El.Ed Result” section.
3.  Select your semester and year.
4.  Enter your roll number and other required details.
5.  Download and print your marksheet.

**What Next?**

*   **Passed:** Verify marksheet, prepare for next semester.
*   **Failed/Low Marks:** Check for revaluation/compartment options.

website_content.title: AKTU One View Result 2026
website_content.markdown_content:
## AKTU One View Result 2026 Released!

Results are now available online for:

*   BHMCT 5th & 7th Semester
*   BFAD 1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th Semester
*   BVoc 1st, 3rd, 5th Semester (Session 2025–26)

**How to Check:**

1.  Visit [aktu.ac.in](https://aktu.ac.in)
2.  Enter your University Roll Number.
3.  Enter your Date of Birth (DD/MM/YYYY).
4.  Submit and view your result.

**Key Details in Result:**

*   Student Name, Father's Name, University Roll Number
*   College Name & Code
*   Course, Branch, Semester
*   Subject-wise Marks (Theory/Practical/Internal)
*   Total Marks, SGPA, CGPA
*   Result Status (PASS/FAIL/ABSENT/INCOMPLETE)

**Revaluation/Scrutiny:**

AKTU will announce online application process for revaluation/scrutiny after results are published. Check the official website for notifications.

Results available from February 25, 2026.

website_content.title: VBIT Result 2026 Released
website_content.markdown_content:
## VBIT Result 2026 (Out) for M.Tech, MBA & Ph.D. (December 2025)

VBIT has released the results for M.Tech, MBA, and Ph.D. coursework examinations held in December 2025. Students can download their result sheets from the official portal, vbithydexams.in, using their hall ticket or login credentials.

**Key Details:**

*   **Programmes:** M.Tech, MBA, Ph.D.
*   **Exam Date:** December 2025
*   **Result Release Date:** 2026
*   **Website:** vbithydexams.in

**How to Check:**

1.  Visit the official VBIT exams portal.
2.  Locate the result links for your programme.
3.  Enter your Hall Ticket Number/Register Number and other required credentials.
4.  Download and print the result PDF.

**Passing Rules (R22 Regulation):**

*   Theory subjects: 40% in CIE + 60% in SEE.
*   Minimum 40% in both CIE and SEE is required to qualify.
*   Overall minimum of 50% combining CIE and SEE for a pass.
